texts.en: Umedjon is a young and energetic man. He is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents. Umedjon has worked as a store clerk for four years. His salary is his main source of income, as he has no business of his own. Umedjon's house is in a shabby state and he wants to perform repairs. He wants to repair the house's courtyard first. Umedjon is planning to pour new concrete floor, but has no money to purchase cement, sand and other supplies. Umedjob is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars and awaits your kindness. This loan will help him improve his living conditions. Umedjon is a responsible man who will pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house repairs

loans.name: Zakhira

texts.ru:
Захира – участник группы «Бек - Бол», ей 40 лет,  имеет 3 детей. Захира в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством.
В целях развития своего бизнеса, Захира обратилась в банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 20 овец и закуп ГСМ на весеннее – полевые работы.  Доходы от кредита Захира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zakhira is a member of the "Bek-Bol" group. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Zakhira supports her family by raising livestock and farming. In order to expand her business Zakhira has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS). She plans to purchase 20 sheep and diesel fuel for the planting season. Zakhira will use the profits from this loan to expand her herd.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and fuel

loans.name: Batmakan

texts.ru:
Батмакан  51 год, воспитывает 2 детей. Батмакан в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав после распада Советского Союза с суммы (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Батмакан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 3,7 га земли с картошкой и многолетними травами.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого скота и ядохимикатов для обработки земли.  Доходы от кредита Батмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а  также начать копить на контракт на обучение для детей.
texts.en: Batmakan is 51 and has two children. She earns a living for her family through animal husbandry. She started out after the breakup of the Soviet Union with 10,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Batmakan's farm now has 2 head of cattle with calves, and 3.7 hectares of land planted in potatoes and perennial grasses. With the goal of expanding her business, Batmakan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners Microlending Bank for a loan in the amount of 55,000 soms (KGS) to buy a sheep and pesticides to apply to the soil. Batmakan plans to invest the proceeds gained from the loan into further augmenting her number of livestock, as well as to save up for the children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep and pesticides

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old single guy. He has three younger siblings. Mohammad is a university student majoring in economics. He is applying for an educational loan to help him pay the semester fees on time.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 31-year-old divorced man. During the day time, he works as a cashier. After that he goes to work at his own small shop, where he sells a few types of hot drinks. He is now applying for a loan to add a refrigerator to his shop so he can serve cold drinks soon in the summer.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 6 sons and daughters. Her husband is a farmer, while she sells clothes at home. Now Maryam is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes to sell and get new spring collection.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут Рустамчон. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. В течение многих лет он занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры. У него 8  коровы и  12 барана. У него 10 га земли, где выращивает зерновые культуры. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  14000  сомони для покупки скота и минерального удобрения, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A man with a generous soul and a kind heart needs your help as he has found himself in financial difficulties. His name is Rustamjon. He is married and has four children. The climate in his region allows for farming and raising livestock and Rustamjon has been farming for many years. He has a herd of 8 cows and 12 sheep and 10 hectares of land where he grows cereals. Rustamjon sells livestock for meat after fattening the animals for a few months. He has many regular clients at the local livestock market. Rustamjon wants to expand his business but he has no savings. He is requesting a loan of 14000 somoni to purchase cattle and fertilizer. He is planning to use the profits from this loan to provide his children with good education and modern electronics. Rustamjon awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор очень опытный бизнес мен. Более 10 лет он занимается купле продажей муки. Он имеет торговую точку на местном рынке. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов, так как он продает высококачественный товар. Абдугафор упорно трудится, для того, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще маленькие. Его жена домохозяйка, так как недавно у них родился сын. Абдугафор запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки муки, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Он обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Abdugafor is an experienced business man. He has been re-selling flour for 10 years. Abdugafor has his own stall at the local market and regular clients as he sells only high quality product. Abdugafor is determined to work hard so that he can provide his family with all the necessities. He is married and is raising three young children. Abdugafor's wife stays at home as they have a newborn son. Abdugafor is requesting a loan of 7500 somoni to purchase flour in bulk and have more working capital on hand, which will allow him to have higher profits. He hopes for your kindness and charity. Abdugafor promises to pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy flour and increase working capital

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal was able to participate in some exhibitions for embroidered items, which has helped in promoting her work. She is now applying for another loan to buy a few missing tools to enhance her embroidery business. She also wants to start making new items, such as embroidered frames.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery tools.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Kiteredde with his family. He has 4 children:  the youngest is 5 years old, while the oldest is 16. He is involved in agriculture and deals in both animals and food crops.

He currently needs some money to buy manure for his gardens. He also hopes to buy a few more cows. His major challenge is competition and the price fluctuations in the market.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
La Joven  Edis  de 21 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres y se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio  que es un mercadito donde vende lo que es todo en abarrotería, vende refrescos, embutidos y todo en granos básicos.
Edis está solicitando el crédito para compra de mercadería como lociones, perfumes, cremas, carteras, aretes, pulseras, etc. para damas  siendo este su segundo negocio donde pondrá a la venta este tipo de productos,   sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos  de su barrio y de otros barrios cercanos,.
Edis  espera que con esta inversión que realice a su negocio mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia desea seguir mejorando su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es abrir otro negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Marzo del 2013.
texts.en:
Edis is a 21-year-old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents. She has had her business for five years, a small market where she sells all kinds of groceries, soft drinks, cold cuts, and all basic grains. 

Edis is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise like women's lotions, fragrances, creams, purses, earrings, bracelets, etc. This is her second business, where she will sell this type of products. Her customers ar all the friends and neighbors from her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. 

Edis expects to somewhat improve her and her family's quality of life through this investment in her business. She wishes to keep improving her business and offer her customers better service.

Her dream is to open another business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, fragrances, creams, purses, earrings, bracelets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik is from Aygeshat village of the Armavir region, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and son.

Manik is engaged in land cultivation. Particularly, she cultivates tomatoes, onions, and melons, and grows cherry trees. Manik's husband sells the gathered harvest locally and gathers income, which is the only income for family.

It is very difficult for Manik and her husband to sustain the family and the agricultural income is very important to them. They own an greenhouse that is too old and needs to be renovated, but unfortunately Manik and her husband have no financial funds for doing the renovation. Manik has requested this loan from SEF International to renovate her old greenhouse and purchase fertilizer for the cultivation of her crops.

The loan will enable this family to cultivate fruits and vegetables in new greenhouse and gather higher income. Manik dreams to give her family appropriate living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and to cover the renovation costs of her greenhouse.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 19-year-old single lady. She has seven siblings. Being in a big family increases the financial pressure on the parents, especially when they want all of their children to get a better education. Iman is a second-year student at the university. She is applying for an educational loan to help her pay for the next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru: Эмомали житель города Дангара, расположенный в южной части страны. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него две дочери и два сына, которые учатся в школе. Эмомали занимается торговым бизнесом. На рынке города у него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает различные виды посуд. Он занимается этим бизнесом вот уже 10 лет. Эмомали очень опытный торговец, так как он обслуживает своих клиентов вежливо и доброжелательно. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения ассортимента товара (посуды) с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Emomali lives in Dangara in southern Takjikistan. He is 39 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters who are all attending school. Emomali has worked in retail for 10 years and has his own kitchenware store at the local market. He is an experienced salesman and so is always polite and friendly with his clients. Emomali is requesting this loan to purchase more inventory for his store and so expand the variety of goods his store offers which is key to increasing goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory (dishes) for the purpose of increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbaatar, 38 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, shortening roads and delivering them quickly. Eight months ago, he and his wife began running a grocery store as an additional income source. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity from the supplier. As a result, he and his wife can run their grocery store continually without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for his family.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Tahmina. She is widowed and has two children, aged 17 and 18. Her husband died in a car accident. To provice for their household, Tahmina established her sewing services business about 12 years ago.  Her business is located in her house, and her main customers are women. She works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She plans to build a little room in the yard of her house to make it a sewing studio. Tahmina hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies.

Tahmina would like to apply for a loan of 700 AZN manat, to buy additional supplies of tailoring materials like fabric, needles, thread and other accessories needed in her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of tailoring materials like fabric, needles, thread and other accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa works hard to support her family. Nilfa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Nilfa has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Nilfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Gilbert from Harare, the capital city of Zimbabwe. He is married with three children, two attending school. He also cares for one dependent. 

Gilbert runs a service business where he prints batik materials. The business has been in operation for three years. He says the main challenge faced is lack of adequate capital to meet the increased demand. 

Gilbert has requested a loan of USD 750 to buy more printing materials to meet pending orders. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Gilbert plans to own a printing company.

loans.use: to buy more printing materials for his business.

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомуроду 46 лет. Он женат и является отцом двоих детей. Его дочь учится в школе, а сын еще маленький. Бобомурод со своей семьей живет в южной части Таджикистана в городе Дангара. Он предприимчивый, честный человек. Бобомурод работает в сфере торговли в течение 9 лет. Рядом с домом у него имеется небольшой магазин, в котором он занимается продажей продуктов питания, в частности конфеты, печенье, рулеты, чай, сахар, масло и т.д. и хозяйственных товаров. Бобомурод запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента товара с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Bobomurod is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. Hie daughter attends school and his son is still a toddler. Bobomurod lives with his family in southern Tajikistan in Dangara. He is an entrepreneur and an honest man. Bobomurod has worked in retail for 9 years and manages a grocery store close to his home. His grocery store sells candy, cookies, rolls, tea, sugar, butter as well as household items. Bobomurod is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of bulk groceries so that he has more variety to offer in his store and so make it more desirable for the clients, which will result in increased goods turnover.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries in bulks and so increase goods turnover in his store

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Innocent from Harare. He is married with two children, one attending school. He also cares for one dependent. Innocent runs a grocery shop. The business has been in operation for 12 years. He says the main challenge faced is competition from well-stocked big grocery shops. 

Innocent has requested a loan of $750 to increase the stock levels of his shop. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to finish building a house for his family. In the future Innocent plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to increase stock levels.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married and has four grown children. She is engaged in a livestock business, raising piglets, fattening and selling them. Carmelita finds joy in performing her livestock business which is why, up to the present, she is managing the business. 

Carmelita's dream in life is to have a sow to breed. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy piglets to raise to become sows. Carmelita hopes that the loan will serve as a step in attaining her dream.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise to become sows.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is 33 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Niña works very hard to provide for them.

Niña runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil and other groceries for her general store.

Niña has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil and other groceries. 

Niña would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil and other groceries.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Bridget from Harare. She is single and has no children. Bridget operates a hair-dressing salon and has a flea market where she also sells clothes. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges she faces is the lack of capital especially when seasons change. 

Bridget has requested a loan of $500 to buy more clothes for her flea market and chemicals for hair products. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future Bridget plans to own a clothing shop and open another hair-dressing saloon.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock and chemicals for hair products.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Farming is the main source of income for Evangelista's family. She is 46 years old and is married with three children who she is sending to school. Evangelista’s children are in high-school. She has to work hard and find other sources of income to be able to bestow on her children what they need for school, especially as they are about to take up a college level of education.

Evangelista also engages herself in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. Evangelista shares that when she gains profit from farming, she prioritizes her children's school allowances. Since she has a shortage in having feed for her hogs, Evangelista decided to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed to maintain her hogs. She hopes to grow her hogs faster and to sustain their immediate needs.

loans.use: to buy feed to maintain her hogs.

loans.name: Azara

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Azara from Harare, shown standing while her friend is fanning the fire. A married mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, Azara has been operating a canteen where she prepares meals for clients for eight years. She says her main challenge is the fact that her canteen is in an open space and she is forced to close when there is bad weather.

Azara has requested a loan of $600 to buy non-perishable food for her canteen. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Azara plans to operate a restaurant and a takeway in Chinhoyi.

loans.use: to buy non-perishable food for her canteen.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
Марифат любящая мать 3 детей. Маърифат торгует на рынке ювелирными изделиями, раньше она торговала детской одеждой, но с годами этот вид бизнеса ей приносил меньше дохода чем раньше. Ее знакомые и подруги давно торгует ювелирными изделиями, она также решила реализовать серебро. Ее младший сын помогает в бизнесе когда Марифат уезжает за товаром за пределы города.
  В этом году Марифат планирует выдать дочь замуж, так как к ней приходят много хороших сватов. Она хочет сделать хорошее приданное для своей дочери, к лету она планирует  собрать деньги на приданное.  На полученный кредит хочет увеличить свой товарооборот и разнообразить ассортимент.
texts.en: Marifat is a loving mother of three children and sells jewelry at the local market. Previously she sold children's clothes, but the business had become less and less profitable. Her friends and acquaintances have been selling jewelry for a while and Marifat also decided to try her hand at selling silver. Her youngest son helps Marifat manage the store when Marifat herself is away to purchase more inventory. This year Marifat is planning to have a wedding for her daughter as she has many suitors. She wants to provide a nice dowry for her daughter so she is saving money for this summer's wedding. Marifat plans to use this loan to increase goods turnover and expand her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Abiba

texts.ru:
Абибе 55 лет. Абиба в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав этот бизнес 19 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Абибы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 головы крупного рогатого скота.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Абиба обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для получения доходов от продажи молока.  Доходы от кредита Абиба планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а в ближайшее время планирует провести ремонт времянки.
texts.en: Abiba is 55 years old. She has been raising livestock for 19 years to provide for her family. Abiba started her business with 5,000 som (KGS) and worked hard to expand her herd to 3 cows. In order to further grow her business Abiba has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) which she will use to purchase milk cows for her dairy business. Abiba will use the profits from this loan to purchase more animals for her herd and also hopes to repair her shed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is a 52-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two daughters. Since 2006, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. 

Sabiha has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a range of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is very hardworking and an honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamila is a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her children and husband. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. Presently his rickshaw has stopped working and because of that, he is not able to generate any income to meet the needs of his family. He wants to do maintenance on the rickshaw as soon as possible because this is the only source of income for his family. 

Mrs. Jamila has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. The loan amount will help her husband to maintain his rickshaw so that he can continue his business. She will use the profit amount for household necessities. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their rickshaw.

loans.name: Sheril

texts.en:
Sheril is 36 years old, married to a hard-working farmer, and blessed with three children. Sheril’s children are all attending school. Sheril and her husband are striving to finish their children's education. According to her, they don’t have any treasure to leave their children but she believes that the best treasure she will leave to their children is education.

Sheril runs a hog-raising business in their village. Nowadays, feed products in the market are costly. Sheril can’t sustain her hogs with feed and at the same time her children's allowances in school. 

Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed to maintain her hogs. She will manage her business well for her children future.

loans.use: to buy feed to maintain her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Tendai from Harare. She is married with one child. Tendai runs a retail business where she sells clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for two and a half years. She says the main challenge faced is the lack of adequate capital to increase her stock. 

Tendai has requested a loan of $1,000 buy more children's wear and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build a house for her family. In the future Tendai looks forward to business growth.

loans.use: to buy more children's wear and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan manages a retail business in her village. She sells junk foods, biscuits and spices in her village. Her husband is farmer. When he has extra time, Susan’s husband operates their motorcycle to transport passengers for extra income.

Susan is happy living with her three children. With their source of income, Susan is able to send her children to school so they can finish their education. Susan wanted to continues to operate the business even if her children become professionals. 

Susan is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy drinks, canned goods and rice to sell. She hopes to earn income to have savings for her future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods and rice to sell.

loans.name: Gulaysho

texts.ru:
Гулайшо жительница Яванского района. Ей 47 лет. Она вдова. У нее одна дочь, которая учится в средней школе. Гулайшо ответственная женщина, которая старается расширить свою деятельность и обеспечивать, растить дочь.
Гулайшо имеет среднее образование. С детства она любила шить и вышивать. Свою деятельность она начала в 23 года. Вот уже более 20 лет Гулайшо шьет платья. Она имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Также Гулайшо занимается вышивкой. 
Гулайшо берет кредит для приобретения тканей и ниток для вышивания. Она хочет увеличить количество клиентов.
texts.en: Gulaysho lives in Yavan region. She is 47 years old, widowed and has one school age daughter. Gulaysho is a responsible woman who is working hard to expand her business so that she can provide for her daughter. Gulaysho has a high school degree and has been sewing and embroidering since childhood. She has started her business when she was 23 years old and has been sewing traditional Tajik dresses for sale for 20 years. Gulaysho has a lot of skill and experience sewing clothes and is also a skilled embroiderer. She is taking out this loan to purchase fabric and embroidery floss as she wants to expand her client base.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and embroidery floss

loans.name: Aslamhon

texts.ru: Асламхон житель города Куляб. Ему 44 года. У него жена, две дочери и два сына. Жена Асламхон домохозяйка. Старшая дочь закончила школу, а остальные дети еще учатся в школе. Асламхон занимается изготовлением сундука. Он научился этому делу у своего мастера и уже 20 лет как он изготавливает и продает сундуки. Он закупает лесоматериал с города Душанбе, изготавливает сундук у себя дома и затем вывозит на рынок на продажу. В его деле ему помогает старший сын. Асламхон запрашивает кредит для приобретения лесоматериала для изготовления сундука. За счет прибыли он планирует приобрести деревообделочный станок, чтобы улучшить качество своей работы.
texts.en: Aslamhon live in Kulob. He is 44 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters. Aslamhon's wife is a home maker. His eldest daughter has finished school and the rest of the kids are still attending it. Aslamhon makes a living as a woodworker, he makes wooden chests. He has learned his trade from a master woodworker and has had his business for 20 years. Aslamhon purchases lumber in Dushanbe, then makes his trunks at home and drives them to a local market for sale. His eldest son helps his father. Aslamhon is requesting this loan to purchase bulk lumber for trunk making. He is hoping to use the profits to purchase a woodworking machine which will improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for making wooden trunks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes & shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Насимчону 43 года. Он женат и у него один взрослый сын. Насимчон со своей семьей и с матерью проживает в городе Худжанд. Худжанд - город на севере Таджикистана, административный центр Согдийской области. Жена Насимчона домохозяйка. Сын работает мастером-отбельщиком, и одновременно учится в высшем учебном заведении.  Насимчон имеет диплом о высшем образовании. Но к сожалению, он не работал по специальности. Он работал в России в качестве шофера. Насимчон в течение 7 лет занимался там услугой маршрутного такси на автомашине марки Газель. Приехав на Родину, он хочет продолжить деятельность в этой сфере. У него имеется немного сбережений для покупки автомашины. Насимчон запрашивает кредит для приобретения микроавтобуса марки Газель, и планирует перевозить пассажиров по маршруту №27 города Худжанд.
texts.en: Nasimjon is 43 years old, married and has an adult son. He lives with his family and his mother in Khujand. Khujand is located in northern Tajikistan and is the administrative center of the Sogdiy region. Nasimjon's wife is a homemaker, his son works as a master painter and also attend college classes. Nasimjon also has a college degree, but unfortunately he does not work in his profession. He worked in Russia as a driver for seven years, driving a "Gazelle" shuttle bus. After returning home he wants to continue working as a taxi driver. Nasimjon has some personal savings which he will use to purchase his own shuttle bus, but he is also requesting this loan to supplement the car purchase. Nasimjon plans to transport passengers along the line #27 in Khujand.

loans.use: to purchase a "Gazelle" shuttle bus

loans.name: Sa'dullo

texts.ru: Саъдулло уже повторно обращается за кредитом. Свой предыдущий заем он брал для покупки холодильника и посуды в свою столовую. За счет прибыли от деятельности он расширил свою столовую и выдал замуж дочь. Саъдулло провел ремонтные работы в столовой и рядом с ней открыл шашлычную, что позволило увеличить количество клиентов. В данный момент Саъдулло нуждается в повторном кредите. Он просит кредит для приобретения большого холодильника, прибора для резки мяса и необходимой посуды.
texts.en: Sa'dullo is returning for another loan. He used his previous loan to purchase a refrigerator and dishes for his cafe. This loan helped Sa'dullo to expand his cafe business and also pay for his daughter's wedding. Now Sa'dullo has has improved his cafe space and also opened a kebab stall nearby, which allowed him to expand his client base. Now Sa'dullo needs another loan which he will use to buy a large freezer, a meat slicer and more dishes.

loans.use: to purchase a larger freezer, a meat slicer and dishes

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru: Иномжон житель района Спитамен. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него две дочери и один сын. Жена Иномжона работает в дехканском хозяйстве (это индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором выращивают сельскохозяйственную культуру). Его старшая дочь швея, а остальные дети учатся в школе. Сам Иномжон работает в заводе шофером собственной грузовой машины. Сейчас он просит выдать кредит для открытия бизнеса "купля-продажа крупнорогатого скота". При дворе дома у него имеется срай для содержания скота и корм.  На сумму кредита Иномжон намерен купить двух голов крупнорогатого скота. Продолжительность откорма скота будет составлять 60 дней. Иномжон намерен реализовать крупнорогатый скот на скотном рынке Спитаменского района.
texts.en: Inomjon lives in Spitamen region. He is 38 years old, married and has two daughters and a son. Inomjon's wife works in dekhan farming co-op, his eldest daughter is a seamstress, and the other children are still attending school. Inomjon primarily works as a driver contractor for a factory, he has his own truck. Now he is requesting a loan to open a cattle business. Inomjon has a nice barn for the animals and plenty of feed. He is planning to use this loan to purchase two cows and feed them for 60 days. Inomjon plans to sell at the animals at the Spitamen livestock market.

loans.use: to buy cattle for subsequent resale

loans.name: Munodaani

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Munodaani from Harare. She is married with two children, both attending school.  Munodaani runs a clothing business. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are transport costs which  are very high. Munodaani has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build a house for her family. In the future Munodaani plans to run a big company employing at least five people.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 54 years old. He lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with his wife and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Ramin requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Ramin works as an artisan on building constructions and his wife is a nurse. They both have small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ramin requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ramin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Ramin will purchase a milk cow. His wife will milk the cow and will produce dairy products to sell. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly increase the monthly income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 48 years old. He lives in Gurjaani district with his retired mother. Mikheil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Mikheil’s father and wife are working abroad. They send home money transfers for the family and that’s the only income for them. 

Mikheil requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Mikheil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Mikheil will purchase a plot of agricultural land where there is a vineyard and also where peach trees are growing. He already has some savings and needs this loan to add to them and buy the land. As there are already crops growing on the land, Mikheil soon will have a good harvest. He is planning to use the profit and renovate his house to function as a hotel. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of agricultural land

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a widowed mother of four. She is engaged in the livestock business, primarily breeding hogs. Editha wishes for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her piglets. Editha is getting old but is still striving because she doesn’t want to rely solely on her children. Editha believes that the loan will be a big help for her in maintaining the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her piglets.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура 26-летная девушка проживающая в городе Турсунзаде. Она не замужем. Манзура живет с родителями. Ее мать домохозяйка. Отец Манзуры работает в заводе, где производят алюминий. 
Манзура вот уже год как предоставляет услугу. Она берет заказы на дому. Манзура в основном шьет национальные платья. Она берет кредит для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки для вышивок, чтобы предоставить качественную услугу и не потерять клиентов.
texts.en: Manzura is a 26 year old woman who lives in Tursun-zoda. She is single and lives with her parents. Her mother is a home maker and her father works at the aluminum processing plant. Manzura has been sewing from her home for a year. She makes traditional Tajik dresses and is taking out this loan to purchase a second sewing machine for embroidery so she can improve the quality of her work and not loose clients.

loans.use: to purchase a second sewing machine for embroidery so she can improve the quality of her work and not loose clients

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rubina is 56 years old. She is a mother of three children and she lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. 

For more than 19 years her husband has been running his own store where he sells a variety of cooking oils. This shop is the only source of income for the family therefore he wants to increase his business. 

Mrs. Rubina is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband will invest the loan amount in the purchase of a variety of cooking oils such as olive oil, soya bean oil, etc. This will allow her to elevate their level of income. 

Mrs. Rubina wants to use the profit for the better education of her children. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cooking oils to sell.

loans.name: Cletos

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Cletos from Harare. He is married with one child.  Cletos runs a clothing business where he sells clothes. The business has been in operation for 3 years. He says the main challenges faced by his business are lack of capital and stiff competition. Cletos has requested a loan of $750 to buy more clothes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's living standard. In the future, Cletos plans to open a large shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 27-year-old Cynthia from Harare, a married mother of one child. For three years now, Cynthia has been running a retail business selling cellphones and accessories. Her main challenge is high competition.

Cynthia has requested a loan of $750 to buy more cellphones for resale. She says the resulting extra income generated will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Cynthia plans to become a supplier of cellphones to other retailers in Harare.

loans.use: to buy more cellphones for resale.

loans.name: Ayesha Group

texts.en:
Ayesha, a 48-year-old hardworking and diligent woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and seven children. Her husband is a laborer whose income is insufficient to pay the school fees of the children and meet the household expenses. Ayesha is helping her husband by selling milk, yogurt, and butter from her home to other people in the suburbs.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy large quantities of milk and other dairy products from the village to resell in the city for profit. With the anticipated profits, she will pay her children's school fees and save for the future.

Ayesha wants to live a happy and peaceful life with her family, and dreams of having her own house. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy dairy products.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines.  Rowena has been in this business for 20 years and has borrowed 14 times from NWTF to sustain it.

Rowena requested a 14,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David raises hogs within his local community.  He has been in this business for seven years.  David is 41 years old and married with two children who attend school.

David is currently fattening 5 hogs and aspires to obtain more hogs to raise.  In the meantime, he has been doing his best to achieve his goals in life.  For this reason, he is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to buy hog feed and essential vitamins.  He knows that by supplying his hogs with proper nutrition he could further improve his profit and way of life.  David is hoping that lenders will grant his loan request.

loans.use: to buy feed and essential vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Blessed Five-City Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Felista from Harare, the capital city of Zimbabwe.  She is married with two children, one of whom attends school.  Felista runs a medical service business where she sells medical products.  The business has been in operation for 3 years.  She says that the main challenges are the lack of capital and the high level of competition. 

Felista has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy medical products for resale.  She says that the extra income will allow her to improve her family’s surplus.  In the future, Felista plans to open a pharmacy in the Harare central business district.

loans.use: to buy medical products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон   39 лет, имеет 5 детей, младшей из которых 2 года. Чолпон в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 25,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, 4 головы мелкого скота.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки овец.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а  в ближайшее время планирует купить бытовую технику для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 39 years old and has five children, the youngest of which is two years. As a source of income for her family, Cholpon works with livestock breeding, after having started five years ago with an amount of 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Cholpon currently has two heads of cattle with offspring and four sheep and goats at her farm. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Cholpon turned to the microfinance organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of cattle through purchasing sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and in the near future she plans to purchase home appliances for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Claudia Esther

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia vive en Guayaquil (orquídeas), ella tiene 28 años de edad. Ella empezó al comienzo vendiendo con una amiga así poca ropa  y de ahí en adelante le gusta venderle ropa  a la gente y interactuar con ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, ella vende la ropa sola, y no tiene horario de trabajo. Las dificultades que se le han presentado en su trabajo son los ladrones que le han arrebatado su dinero. Ella no está casada es soltera, y tiene dos hijos estudian en escuelas particulares.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio como ropa. Sus sueños son tener una casa mas grande para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 28, lives in Guayaqil (Orquídeas).  In the beginning she started out selling a little clothing with a friend.  From then on she liked selling clothes to people and interacting with them.

She sells clothes by catalog.  She sells the clothes alone.  She does not have a work schedule.  The difficulties she has encountered in her work are the thieves who have snatched her money.

She is not married; she is single.  She has two children who attend private schools.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like clothes for her business.

Her dream is to have a bigger house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes for her business.

loans.name: Servita

texts.en:
Servita is a married woman and has five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 58 years old. She has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Servita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.ru: Исломджон добросовестный человек. Ему 41 год. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Исломджон около 20 лет работает учителем литературы в средней школе. Дополнительно он занимается скотоводством и земледелием и в этом помогает его жена. Он выращивает рис и корм для скота. Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Его старший сын данное время в армии. До его приезда Исломджон планирует достроить дом, который он начал несколько лет назад. Он потратил деньги для покупки не обходимого средства для проживания, а также сделал посев. Он данное время не имеет денег для покупки дверей и окон, так как он планирует установить двери и окон. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки дверей и окон. Этот займ поможет ему реализовать свой план «обрадовать сына во время его приезда». Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Islomjon is a conscientious man. He is 41 years old, married, and raising three children. Islomjon has worked as a literature teacher at a secondary school for around 20 years. In addition he works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, and his wife helps him with this. He grows rice and fodder for the livestock. 

Islomjon is the sole supporter of the family. His eldest son is currently in the military. Before he comes back, Islomjon plans to build a house, which he started a several years ago. He spent the money on purchasing necessary means for living, and also for sowing. Currently he does not have money for purchasing doors and windows, which he plans to install.

Islomjon requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of doors and windows. This loan will help him realize his plan of "pleasing his son when he comes back". He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors for building a new house

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 62-year-old Constance, from Harare. She is married and has four children. She cares for one dependent. Constance runs a retail business, where she sells African attire. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenge she faces is the need to travel for longer distances, which sometimes is uncomfortable, at her age.

Constance has requested a loan of $600, which she will use to buy more African attire to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family, and to save for her retirement. In the future, Constance plans to increase her savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy more African attire to resell

loans.name: Maria Eufracia

texts.es:
María Eufracia es una mujer emprendedora de 47 años de edad y junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos se dedican a la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de papa. Ella tiene una amplia experiencia en esta actividad que aprendió hace más de 20 años dicha actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres a los cuales ella les agradece por haberle regalado e inculcado el respeto a su prójimo el amor a DIOS y a la familia y lo más importante en esta vida haberle enseñado a trabajar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo; pero con mucho esfuerzo hizo que sus hijos siguieran estudiando de los cuales el menor de los 3 está cursando la primaria. Hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos mismos que agradecen el esfuerzo de sus padres. Su producto es comercializado y vendido a través de los intermediarios en el mercado local y por ella misma cuando viaja a la ciudad ya que tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado.

María Eufracia actualmente solicita ayuda para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas para la siembra de papas actividad por medio de la cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, alimentos, vestimenta, etc.

Su sueño y su meta es poder ser la mejor productora de papa en la región, que su producto sea el mejor ya que de esa forma ella obtendrá mejores ingresos y podrá darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, un mejor estilo de vida y podrá seguir invirtiendo en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María Eufracia is a very enterprising woman.  She is 47 years old, has three children, and she and her husband raise potatoes.  She has lots of experience in this and learned it 20 years ago when her parents taught her.  She is grateful for this gift and love for her fellow man, God, and family.  The most important thing for her in this life is having been taught to work.  She has a first grade education, but she has made a great effort to ensure that her children continue to study, with the youngest of the three attending elementary school.

She has her husband’s support and that of her children who appreciate their parents’ effort.  She sells her products through intermediaries in the local market and she also makes some sales when she travels to the city, where she has a market stall.

María Eufracia needs help with which to buy seeds and farming supplies for her potato crops, through which she has been able to get ahead with her family.  She has been able to help her children with their studies, food, clothing, etc.

Her dream and her goal is to be able to increase her potato production in the region, since her product is the best and this will allow her to have a better income and she will be able to provide a better education and quality of life for her children.  She will also be able to continue to invest in her crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Victor Daniel

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también tener unas hermosas playas y también se desarrollan las actividades de agricultura y la pesca.

Victor es un joven muy trabajador, con esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de repuestos para vehículos desde ya hace 3 años, se animo a tener este negocio porque el empezó a estudiar la carrera de Mecánica de mantenimiento, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día según la dificultad de la reparación, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy minucioso y sobre todo responsable y cumplido con su trabajo. 

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar bombillas, baterías, claxon, reguladores de voltaje, entre otros, con esta mejora podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes ya que tendrá los implementos necesarios; así el seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de gasfitería y electricidad”.
texts.en:
Víctor lives in the city of Pisco, known for having a warm weather all year long, for its beautiful beaches and for its agricultural and fishing activities. Víctor is a very hard-working young man who, thanks to his efforts and savings, was able to start his own business selling replacement parts for vehicles three years ago. He decided to launch the business after starting his studies in Mechanical Maintenance. He works approximately 8 hours per day and serves up to 10 clients, depending on the degree of complexity of the repair. He thinks things are going well with the business because he is very detailed and responsible. 

Víctor is very grateful to Kiva lenders as this is the second time he is receiving their financial support. He will use this loan to buy bulbs, batteries, horns and voltage regulators, among others, with which he will be able to provide a better service to his clients. He will keep fighting every day to make his biggest dream come true: to have his own plumbing and electrical business.

loans.use: to buy products such as bulbs, batteries, horns and voltage regulators, among others.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Maria vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 8 hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la va almacenando en sacos así como muestra la fotografía  para luego salir a venderlos en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija,  Maria es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  Para obtener mejores  ganancias que le ayudaran a  darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Maria lives with her life’s partner and eight children.  She is a farmer who raises corn and beans and has been doing this for many years.  She has lots of valuable experience which allows her to have better harvests.  When it’s ready she stores it in sacks as shown in the photo and then goes out to sell it in the surrounding areas where she has many steady customers.  Maria is dedicated to her work and is prepared to work hard to reach success.  She wants to take advantage of her business and increase her production so she can have better earnings.  She needs to invest in supplies bud needs working capital, so she is asking for a loan so she can buy corn and sorghum seeds, compost, insecticide, tools, etc., in order to have better earnings that will help give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: David Enoc

texts.es: Don David  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa, sus 3 hijos , su madre y su padre, es un hombre muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor  siembra todos los años maíz y maicillo también trabaja de albañil. Don David desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros ytambien darle una mejora a su terreno que muestra la fotografía donde siembra sus  cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
David is a man who is very responsible about his household obligations and has always been known for providing the best for his children.  He currently lives with his wife, three children, and his mother and father.  He is a hardworking man and is a happy and enthusiastic farmer who raises corn and millet every year.  He also works as a mason.

David wants to increase his sales, so he is asking for a loan so he can buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other things.  He also wants to improve his land shown in the photo.  Here he raises his crops.  He wants to help because he doesn’t have another source of income and wants to continue providing his home with its daily bread without limitation.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Yenny Alexandra

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto en Portoviejo, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.

En este lugar vive la señora Yenny, tiene 50 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen dos hijos de 26 y 15 años de edad, el menor estudia  en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Yenny junto a su marido tienen un negocio de compra y venta de pescado y camarón, trabajan todos los días, en la madrugada su marido se desplaza hasta Puerto López a comprar en los barcos que llegan hasta la playa  ya que allí le salen más baratos el pescado y el camarón. Mientras su esposo se encarga de las ventas en otras ciudades ella se encarga de vender ya sea en su casa o entregando a restaurantes y casas por su localidad,  son más de 15 años que llevan en el negocio y les ha ido muy bien siempre.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas y otros mariscos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the Communal Bank Esperanza Para Superar meets at the beautiful spa of San Jacinto de Portoviejo, surrounded by a beautiful beach where the Portoviejo river flows into the sea and which is visited by many national and international tourists. This is where Yenny lives. She is a 50-year old woman who lives with her partner and has two children with him, aged 26 and 15. The youngest one attends schools and her husband is a salesman. 

Yenny and her husband own a business buying and selling fish and prawns. They work every day. Her husband needs to to to Puerto López very early in the morning to buy from the ships that arrive to the beach offering better prices. He is in charge of selling in other cities, while she sells at home or delivering to restaurants and houses in the area. Things are going well after 15 years in business.

They plan to use the requested loan to buy fish, prawns, shells and other shellfish. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for four years and the loans have helped her a lot in the business. Their dream is to have a big restaurant and to keep growing their business.

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns, shells and other shellfish.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol.  José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso  solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y también para darle una mejora a su terreno donde siembra. Y así tener mejores cosechas que le ayudaran a obtener buenas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is a man who is very responsible about his household obligations and has always been known for providing the best for his children.  He currently lives with his wife and three children, ages 8, 6, and 4.  He is a hardworking man and is a happy and enthusiastic farmer who raises corn and beans every year.  

Jose wants to increase his sales, so he is asking for a loan so he can buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other things.  He also wants to improve his farmland and have a better harvest so he can give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jose Reinaldo

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Él tiene 35 años de edad, casado y su esposa tiene 30 años, goza de dos hijos los cuales tiene edades de 5 y 8 años. El oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo realiza de lunes a sábado, asimismo el realiza el cultivo de frijol.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y pago de arrendamiento del terreno para llevar a cabo la siembra. Esta inversión le ayudara a generar mayores ingresos e incrementar los inventarios.
Su objetivo es brindarle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia, fortalecer más el negocio y obtener mayor producción.
texts.en:
Jose farms and raises livestock.  He is 35 years old, married, and his wife is 30 years old.  He has two children, ages 5 and 8 and raises beans, as he learned from his parents, Monday through Saturday.

He is asking for this loan so he can buy seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides and pay for labor to complete the planting.  This investment will help him generate greater income and increase his inventory.

His goal is to provide better stability for his family, strengthen his business, and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru: Акмалджону 39 лет. Он трудолюбивый человек. Он женат  и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена Дилрабо помогает ему введение бизнеса. Акмалджон более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Он имеет большой опыт и справляется с бизнесом отлично. Он хороший семьянин и старается, чтобы его семья жила комфортно. Он планирует построить новый дом рядом его настоящим домом. Он планирует построить дом с новой планировки с кирпича собственного производства. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки цемента, песка и т.д. для постройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Akmaljon is 39 years old and a very hardworking person.  He is married and has 3 children.  His wife, Dilrabo helps him run his business.  For more than 15 years, Akmaljon has worked in agriculture.  He has much experience and navigates this field excellently.  He's a good family man and works so his family can live comfortably.  He plans to build a new home near his current home.  He plans to build using a new set of blueprints, with bricks he himself manufactures.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy cement, sand, etc. for the construction.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, sand to build a house

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Mrs. Amna is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is a welder by profession. He owns a small welding shop in the main market, which is the only source of income for the family. However, his monthly net income is insufficient to fulfill the needs of his family. Therefore, he is interested in growing his business. 

Amna has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Paksitan, which she will use for her husband's business. The loan amount will help her husband to buy welding materials, such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, and iron sheets. This supply of materials will help him to earn more income. Amna will spend the profit amount to meet the household expenses. 

In their area, the major problem is load shedding (rolling blackouts), which affect the business of her husband. She hopes that this issue will resolve soon. She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 37 years old. He lives in a small village of Sachkhere District, with his wife, three children and parents. HIs parents are provided with a retirement pension. Mikheil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have three milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell cheese at local markets at a good price. They earn hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Mikheil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mikheil has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Mikheil will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, he will be able to transport people and increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport passengers

loans.name: Rosa Exhela

texts.es:
La  señora  Rosa  de 50 años de edad es casada, tiene  01 hijo que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 17  años  a la venta de  tortillas,  pescado fresco.
Doña Rosa sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le  compran sus productos  y  con la ayuda de su esposo que se dedica a la pesca ella ha salido adelante.
Doña Rosa está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pecado seco, maíz, leña y cal. 
Doña Rosa quiere vender sopas de pescado seco y pecado tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Doña Rosa su sueño es mejorar su casa. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Rosa us 50 years old, married and has a dependent son.  She lives in San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras, and has a home of her own. She has been selling tortillas and fresh fish for 17 years.

Rosa is asking for this loan so she can buy dried fish, corn, firewood, and salt.

Rosa’s customers are friends and people who buy from her daily and she has gotten ahead with her husband’s help and her fishing.

Rosa wants to sell soups and dried fish and has several requests from her customers.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Abduvosid

texts.ru: Абдувосид уже несколько лет живет вместе с женой и 3 детьми в доме его родителей. У них маленький дом и поэтому они живут неудобно. Абдувосид отделил свое молодое хозяйство. Он купил земельный участок и начал построить дом. Он начал строить дом современной планировкой. У него в плане достроить дом с большой гостиной и удобной кухней. В этом году он хочет достроить свой дом, но его доход от скотоводства не хватает, чтобы купить строительные материалы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, арматура и т.д. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Abduvosid has lived the past few years together with his wife and three children in the home of his parents.  They have a small house that makes living together uncomfortable.  Abduvosid has acquired his own young farm.  He bought a piece of land and began building a home.  He is building the home with a modern layout.  He wants to build the structure with a large living room and comfortable kitchen.  This year he wants to finish construction but his income from livestock isn't enough to buy building materials.  He is asking for a loan of 2500 somoni to buy construction materials like cement, fittings, etc.  He awaits your kindness as this loan will solve his living arrangement problems.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and fittings for home construction

loans.name: Angela Piedad

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto en Portoviejo, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esperanza Para  Superar.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 47 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 28, 26 y 19 años de edad, los dos menores  aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en Universidad. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Doña es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y así poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a preparar alimentos, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de San Jacinto, allí prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 05h00 hasta las 14h00 ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Sus clientes le piden siempre comidas con  mariscos y ella les da gusto y es por eso que tiene  mucha clientela en el lugar. Tiene más de 7 años con su negocio el cual lo ha ido mejorando con los créditos recibidos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y algún día comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Communal Bank Esperanza Para Superar meets at the beautiful spa of San Jacinto de Portoviejo, surrounded by a beautiful beach where the Portoviejo river flows into the sea and which is visited by many national and international tourists. This is where Ángela lives, a 47-year old woman who lives with her partner and three children, aged 28, 26 and 19. The two youngest still live at home (the youngest one attends university) and her partner works in the fishing industry. 

Ángela is a good housewife that, in order to make some extra money on her own and to help her partner with the household expenses, prepares meals and has a small dining room in the San Jacinto market. She prepares delicious dishes and works Monday through Saturday from 5am to 2pm, serving breakfasts and lunches. Her clients always ask for dishes with shellfish in them and she prepares them, which is why she has a big client base there. She started the business more than 7 years ago and it has been improving thanks to the loans received. 

She plans to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other food products, to prepare meals. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for four years and is happy with the help received through the loans. 

Her goal is to get ahead with her business and to buy a car some day.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other food products.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель района Хуросон, южной части Таджикистана. Ему 44 года. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Его родители живут вместе с ними. Файзулло имеет среднее образование. В течение 11 лет он занимается животноводством, а именно куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Одновременно он занимается садоводством. Файзулло научился этим делам у своего отца. Кредит запрашивает для закупа двух бычков с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. В дальнейшем Файзулло планирует расширить свою деятельность и открыть ферму для скотов.
texts.en:
Faizullo is a resident of the Khuroson region, in the southern part of Tajikistan. He is 44 years old, married, and the father of four children. His parents live together with them. Faizullo has secondary education. He has worked with livestock breeding for a period of eleven years, more specifically he purchases and resells cattle. At the same time he works with field crop cultivation. Faizully learnt this type of activity from his own father. 

He requests a loan for the purchase of two bulls to further fatten and resell. Faizullo plans to expand his business and open a farm for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls with an aim to fatten and resell them

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 52 years old. She lives in Martvili district, with two brothers and her retired mother. Madona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow, one pig, and a plot of agricultural land where nut trees are grown. They milk the cow and make cheese, and this is sold with the harvested nuts, at the local markets.  In addition, the family has additional income from Madona’s mother’s monthly pension.

Recently, Madona requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Madona has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her credit Madona will start trading in flour. She will purchase the product at the wholesale price and sell it, with a price markup, among the villagers and at the local markets. This business will bring Madona an additional income. With this income, she wants to start renovating the family's house, to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading in flour

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 37 years old, married and has been blessed with a family of five that he supports. He has been growing wheat, barley and potatoes for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000.

With his fifth loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 100,000, he plans to purchase seeds for planting and fertilizers. The anticipated profits will support his business and help him to buy a residential plot. His dream for the future is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gina Marlene

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años que estudian en el colegio. El marido es guardia de seguridad. 

Doña Gina es un gran madre y esposa que  para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y sus clientes más conocidos llegan hasta su casa donde tiene su mercadería, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene más de seis años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pantalones, blusas y ropa en general. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Sus sueños son tener un local para vender ropa y todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 4 de Agosto community bank meet in Andrés de Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where Gina lives.  Gina is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are 16, 14 and 11 years old.  They are all attending school.  Gina's husband is a security guard.

Gina is a great mother and wife who, in order to make her own income so that she can help her husband with their children's educational expenses, works selling both catalog clothing and Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day and makes her sales door to door, though some of her most trusted customers come to her home where she keeps her merchandise.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She has been in this business for more than six years and it is going very well.

Gina is requesting this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, pants, blouses and other items of clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for more than two years and likes it because the repayments are easy.

Gina's dream is to have premises where she can sell her clothing and other products.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, pants, blouses and other items of clothing

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Margareth, from Harare. She is married, with two children, both attending school.
