Margareth runs a clothing business where she sells clothes. The business has been in operation for one year. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of working capital. 

Margareth has requested a loan of USD 500 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated, as a result of this loan, will go towards the school fees of her children. In the future, Margareth plans to run a clothing shop where she will be employing at least three people.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old, married and supporting one child. She owns a hotel from which she earns her daily living. She has been in operation for over ten years and her monthly income is KES. 50,000.

She is servicing her second loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase food, e.g., maize flour, wheat flour, crates of milk and sugar, for her hotel business.  

The additional food purchases will be used to expand her business and to open a new one in a different location. Her dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food for her hotel business, e.g.,  maize flour, wheat flour, crates of milk and sugar.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Greetings from Harare. This is 40-year-old Nicholas. He is married with two children, one of whom attends school. Nicholas runs a retail business where he sells electrical equipment. The business has been in operation for three years. He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of capital. Nicholas has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more electrical equipment like televisions, radios and irons. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to finish the construction of his family house. In the future, Nicholas plans to own a big electrical shop.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a fifth grade teacher who started a humble life as a teacher and later joined friends to became a director of Alliance Secondary School. This not only made him self-employed but also gives him the opportunity to continue practicing his profession as a teacher. Wilson is proud of being one of the pioneers of the newly mushrooming Alliance schools in the area and has been recognized by the community and the local authorities for creating employment, offering quality education and participating in the general development of Ibanda. He has purchased two semi-detached residential houses in the neighboring district of Mbarara and has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE to increase his payments to the seller.

loans.use: To complete payments on a house.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five women and one man who sell maize, plain woods, underwear, creams and wigs.

Comfort is the leader of this group. Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Comfort is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Dansoman (in Accra). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Comfort is 39 years old and married with three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards supporting herself and her family. Comfort wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of maize. In the long term, Comfort plans to reinvest future profits into her business to help her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

This group need a total amount of GHS 4,800 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more maize to resell to customers.

loans.name: Nominee

texts.en:
Nominee is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married, with eight children between the ages of 12 and 25. Only two children are in school and live at home. 

Nominee was unable to attend school, so she went into business. For eight years now, she has been selling local red oil, pepper, vita, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this trade from her friends. She spends eight hours, six days a week on her business. Mostly she uses a taxi to get her goods to her market table. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en: Fawzia is a 33-year-old woman and mother of five children. While her husband is serving in the military, Fawzia works in her small food store where she sells basic food products and snacks. Fawzia is applying for a loan to add variety to the goods in her store.

loans.use: to add a variety of goods to the store.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Dilijan town where she lives with her husband and 19-year-old son. Hasmik is a doctor with many years of experience working at a local clinic. Her son, Rudolf, studies at the European Educational Regional Academy in the loyal department.

It is very hard for Hasmik and her husband to sustain the family and, at the same time, cover Rudolf's educational costs. Hasmik has applied for this loan to SEF International to pay for her son's university tuition. The loan is very important for Hasmik and for her son, so he is able to complete the education and become a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 41-year-old, married woman and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost 12 years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market, at a profitable amount. 

Shahida is a responsible mother of three. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life. There were days when her children often slept without having any food. But, now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 14 años que estudian en colegio y universidad y aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un hotel. 

Ella aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en un centro de estudios en esta ciudad, para poder ganar algo por su cuenta  hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otros trabajos más. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende productos de belleza para lo cual tiene unas vitrinas en su mismo local y vende al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos, ella lleva más de 14 años dedicada a esta actividad y con esto se gana lo suficiente para sacar adelante los estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes, cepillos de cabello y tijeras. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es llegar a tener un SPA
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '4 de Agosto' communal bank meet in Andrés de Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province. This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where Flor, age 40, lives.  She is married, and they have two children, ages 19 and 14.  The children attend high school and the university, and they still live with her.  Her husband works at a hotel. 

She learned about beauty and grooming at an educational center in this city.  She did this in order to be able to earn something on her own.  Several years ago she installed a beauty salon in her house.  

She does diverse jobs like dyes, haircuts, and painting nails, among other jobs.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Sometimes she works later if her customers require her services.  

She also sells beauty products, which she has in display cases in her salon.  She sells at the same time that she is doing her work.  She has been doing this business activity for over 14 years.  She earns enough with this to get her children ahead in their education.

She will use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, hairbrushes, and scissors.  She has been in her communal bank for two years.  She likes it because of the help that she gets from the loans.

Her dream is to come to have a spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, hairbrushes, and scissors.

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Ms. Atiya is a hardworking, enterprising 31-year-old woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband makes his living as a day worker, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family.

As a result, she has been in the clothing sales business for almost 7 years. Specifically, she purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market for profits. She faced many problems early on in her married life, but now her contributions to the family's income are playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of her family.

To cope with an expected increase in demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to generate an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on improving the family's house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To satisfy demand by purchasing a variety of clothes in different colors for selling purposes.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 63-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children and they live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Perla works as a farmer and grows vegetables. She has been in this line of business for 20 years.

She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. Perla has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Perla hopes to manage her own large farm.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Mariana Magaly

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Agosto.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  12, 10 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Doña Mariana se dedica al comercio, le encanta vender y vende muchos productos a la vez como cosméticos de Lebel y Esika, artículos para el hogar como planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, zapatos, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los  días por las mañanas ya que en la tarde tiene que ayudar a sus hijos en sus tareas de la escuela. Ella deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana. Tiene cinco años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, planchas, zapatos, etc. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los creditios.
 
Su sueño es ver que  a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The members of the 4 De Agosto community bank meet every 15 days in the parish of Andrés De Vera in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees. 

Mariana lives in this place.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are 5, 10, and 12 years old.  The oldest studies at high school and the younger two are in school.  Her husband is employed at a private company.  

Mariana works in retail.  She loves to sell and offers many products at the same time such as cosmetics from Lebel and Esika and home goods such as irons, fans, blenders, shoes, and other items.  She works every day in the mornings since in the afternoon she has to help her children with their homework.  She sells on credit and collects her money on the weekends.  She has been doing this work for 5 years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase perfume, lotion, cosmetics, irons, shoes, and other items.  She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years and she likes it for the help the loans provide.

Her dream is to see her children do not lack for anything.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lotion, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her mother and sister. Mariam is a 21-year-old and studies at Vanadzor State College of Medicine. Mariam's mother is involved in agriculture, which is the main source of their family's income. 

Unfortunately, the current income that Mariam's family earns is barely enough to cover the household costs and doesn't allow them to save money for Mariam's education. So Mariam has applied for this loan from SEF International to get necessary funds to pay for her university tuition.

Mariam dreams of becoming a doctor after graduation and having a job with enough salary to be financially independent. This loan is important for her to continue her education and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is 54 years old. He lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with his wife.

The only source of income for his family is from agricultural activities. They have a milking cow, whose milk is used for cheese products. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow walnut trees. They sell the harvested walnuts and cheese locally, but it is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Vitali has requested loans from local financial institutions on several occasions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Vitali requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Vitali has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup loans to poor rural people, who do not have access to credit. These poor rural people, Vitali included, are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan proceeds, Vitali would like to begin trading groceries. Specifically, he plans to purchase a stock of groceries in Sachkhere and to then re-sell the groceries for profits from his home. He expects that the loan will allow him to increase the family's income. As a result, he believes that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business by purchasing and selling groceries

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 38 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su madre, a quien agradece todo su apoyo brindado, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabar desde muy joven, Carlos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja como chofer de un camión, brindando servicios de carga, él cuenta con pequeño camión el cual alquila para laborar, Carlos puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el pintado de una de las puertas del camión que alquila, ya que hace poco sufrió un pequeño accidente y debe arreglarlo para seguir trabajando, así pues Carlos podrá contar con mayor seguridad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 38-year old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica with his mother, to whom he is grateful for her support. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, and works hard to get ahead. Unfortunately, and despite his willing to do so, Carlos could not attend university due to a lack of financial resources and the need to start working at an early age. He likes to play soccer with friends in his free time. 

With a lot of effort and dedication, Carlos took the initiative to start working as a truck driver providing freight services. He rents a small truck and works for approximately 12 hours per day. He thinks things are going well because he is responsible and kind to his clients. 

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to repair and paint one of the truck's doors that was damaged after a small accident. He needs to repair it to continue working and to have a higher degree of safety at work.

loans.use: to repair and paint one of his truck's doors.

loans.name: Deeba

texts.en:
Ms. Deeba is 44 years old and a vigorous, married woman; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available of funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation.

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. These supplies will become a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier income. She is in her first loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones Victoria es madre soltera, hace varios años se separó de quien fue su esposo, desde entonces ella ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; Victoria es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Victoria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pasteles, queques y otros, ella trabaja todos los días en su hogar preparando sus delicias y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Victoria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, ladrillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para reforzar y mejorar su vivienda, de esta manera Victoria y su familia podrá contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 56-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her two children, who she loves and who are her principal reason for living. Unfortunately, for various reasons, Victoria is a single mother. She separated from the person that was her husband several years ago, and since then she has dedicated all her effort to getting her family ahead. 

Victoria is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person. She could not study a professional degree in nursing because she has had to work since she was very young. In her free time she likes to make delicious desserts to share with her family. Victoria works in a small store selling pies, cakes and other things, on her own initiative and with much dedication and determination.

She works every day in her home preparing these delights and she can do so for approximately 12 hours. She feels happy doing her work and believes that it is going well for her due to her good flavors and the friendly treatment she offers her clients.

Victoria is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer her, she will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and more, which will help her a lot to strengthen and improve her home. This way, Victoria and her family will be able to count on better security and well-being. Thus she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 49-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children and they live in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Concepcion works as a farmer and grows vegetables. She has been in this line of business for 15 years.

She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Concepcion hopes to have her own large farm.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming operations by purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Saba'a

texts.en:
Saba'a is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. Saba'a is a 32-year-old, married woman, who has four sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Tulkarm city, in a simple house.

The husband of Saba'a has been working as a taxi driver for ten years, and this is the only source of income for the family. This income can barely cover the family's needs. Saba'a took a USD loan, to help her husband cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi. This will help the family meet some of the current expenses they face.

loans.use: to pay the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi

loans.name: Ángela Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 26 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene un hijo de 5 años que estudia en escuela. Su marido trabaja en un tanquero.
 
Doña Ángela con la finalidad de ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  a las personas que habitan por su sector, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las mañana y así aprovecha cuando su hijo está en la escuela  y puede salir con más libertad. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una vez por mes y a veces dos veces de acuerdo a lo que venda o pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito es para realizar un viaje a Guayaquil a comprar ropa. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que vive es la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Los Corrales meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales, a few minutes away from Montecristi. Most people there work in activities such as craftsmanship and trade in general. This is where Ángela lives. She is a 26-year old woman who lives with her partner and has a 5-year old son who attends school. Her partner works with a tank wagon. 

With an aim to help his partner with the household expenses, Ángela started her business selling all kind of clothing items. She sells door to door to people in the area, gives credit and receives the money every week. She works four days per week in the morning, when her son is at school and she has more freedom. She buys the products in Guayaquil, where she goes once or twice per month, depending on the sales and orders she has. 

She will use the requested loan to cover the trip expenses to Guayaquil to buy clothes. She is a co-founder of the communal bank and is happy for the help she receives from the loans. Her dream is to have her own home as they currently live in her parents-in-law's house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Moayyad

texts.en:
Moayyad is a 22-year-old, single man. His mother is a worker with a very low income that barely covers the family's needs. Moayyad is a university student who wants to complete his studies.

He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, which he will use to help him cover the cost of a new laptop. The laptop will help Moayyad to do his homework and reports, and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Moayyad and, ultimately, improve the family's living conditions. (Moayyad is photographed at the store where he purchases the laptop.)

loans.use: to buy a new laptop, which will help him pursue his University studies

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 45 year-old man who is the father of six sons and daughters. Nidal is an artistic man who draws with colored sand inside different shapes of bottles. He participates in different bazaars and artistic exhibitions to show and sell his work. He also works in a training center to teach his artwork. Now Nidal is applying for a loan to increase his work by buying more bottles in different sizes and more sand.

loans.use: buy more bottles in different sizes.

loans.name: Johanna Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo de 4  años. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Johanna es una ama de casa que para ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y sus clientes también llegan hasta su casa a comprar su mercadería,  la mayoría de las veces sale en las  mañanas ya que a esta hora su suegra le cuida a su pequeño hijo, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 2 años con su negocio y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito pudo empezar su negocio.

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Corrales" (The Corrals) meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. In this place the majority of the people make their livings doing different activities such as crafts and general trade.

Johanna, 28, lives in this place. She is married and with her husband she has a 4-year-old son. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. Johanna is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income and with it help her husband with the home expenses, sells all types of clothing. She makes her sales door-to-door and her customers also come to her house to buy her merchandise. 

The majority of the time she leaves in the morning since at that time her mother-in-law can take care of her small child for her. She sells on credit and charges every eight or fifteen days. She has had her business for over two years and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and other clothing items. She has been with the Communal Bank for two years and she likes it because, thanks to her first loan, she was able to start her business. Her dream is to have her own home since she lives in her parents-in-law's house.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and other clothing items

loans.name: Mobina

texts.en:
Ms. Mobina is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been doing the business of tailoring since five years ago to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children. 

That is why Mobina started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand without fail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Mobina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is married with three children. She is 49-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Irenia is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 13 years. 

She has requested a loan in order to buy fertilizer.

Irenia has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for five years. In the future, Irenia hopes to have her own large farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Ms. Zeenat is a 29-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and she is proud to be contributing to the household income. When Zeenat was not working, her family went through a severe financial crisis.  This improved when she began to use her sewing skills in a productive manner and started earning for her family members. Previously, her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources none of their five children were sent to school. Therefore, Zeenat felt it obligatory to change her family’s standard of living and started working from home.

Zeenat has been having difficulty fulfilling large orders so her neighbor advised her to borrow from Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new sewing machine. She is presently in her seventh loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 20 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single with two children aged 2 and 4. Both of them live at home and only one attends school.

Siah stopped her education at seventh grade. She has been selling alcoholic drinks such as Black Horse gin, Godfather gin, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more Black Horse gin, Godfather gin, etc. for her business. Her future plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more Black Horse gin, Godfather gin, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Graciela Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Avance Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Graciela, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos, 7 mayores de edad y dos de  16 y 13 años, tres de ellos  estudian en universidad y colegio y son los que aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor y chofer.

Doña Graciela realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica a la agricultura, en la temporada invernal él siembra maíz, maní y ciertas verduras. Él también tiene un bus de una cooperativa intercantonal en el cual trabaja tres días a la semana y que el resto de los días sus hijos se hacen cargo de  trabajar en el bus ya que él tiene que dedicarse a sus cultivos, para lo cual tiene dos o tres personas que trabajan con él y a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo,  toda su vida se a dedicado a esta actividad ya que desde pequeño él trabajaba junto a su papá.
  
Este crédito es para comprar ciertos insumos y fertilizantes agrícolas y así tener una buena cosecha. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales
texts.en:
Avance y Desarrollo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Junín Canton, a place known for its friendly and hardworking people and because it's where they distill the best liquor in the province and in Ecuador.

This is where Graciela lives.  She's 55 years old and married, and has nine children from this relationship, seven adults and two ages 16 and 13.  Three of them attend the university and high school, and are the ones who still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer and a driver.

Graciela needs the loan for her husband's business.  He works in agriculture.  In the winter he grows corn, peanuts, and certain vegetables.  He also has a cooperative inter-canton bus on which he works three days a week; the rest of the week he has to work on his crops so his children are responsible for working on the bus.  He has two or three people who work with him in the fields and he pays them a weekly salary.  He has earned a living in this job his whole life because when he was young he worked alongside his father.  

This loan is to buy certain agricultural inputs and fertilizer to have a good harvest.

She has been with the communal bank for more than two years and she likes it because of the help she receives with the loans.  Her dream is for her children to finish school and be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms. Tahira is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She has been running a business of trading clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells it to the people of her neighborhood. She has become well known for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough to fulfill the needs of family members. 

Tahira has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation in order to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her child through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of a variety of different clothes.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 45-year-old man, who lives in Kakyenkye with his family of four children. The oldest of the children is 16, while the youngest is 4 years old.

Henry rears cattle that he sells to earn a living. He also sells milk and plans to buy more dairy cows, to increase his milk production. He hopes that when he has more milk to sell, then his burden of school fees can be reduced. His dream is that, by the time his children get to university, his cattle farm will be able to support their tuition and fees.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Safaa is a 20 year old single lady. She has two brothers. Safaa is attending university studying history. She is applying for a loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Rocio Guadalupe

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Avance Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del Ecuador.

En este lugar  vive la señorita Guadalupe, tiene 19 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.

Ella es una joven muy trabajadora que para ayudar a sus padres realiza el crédito para invertirlo en el negocio familiar, ellos tienen un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad donde junto a su madre preparan varios platos, hasta su local día a  día acuden muchas personas a servirse su deliciosa comida, ellas preparan desayunos y almuerzos y  los fines de semana también meriendas, el plato preferidos por sus clientes es el viche de mariscos, sus clientes las prefieren porque hacen sus platos deliciosos y por la atención que les brindan.
  
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la  gran ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es estudiar una carrera universitaria ya que no lo ha podido hacer por no contar con los recursos económicos suficientes.
texts.en:
Avance y Desarrollo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Junín Canton, a place known for its friendly and hardworking people and because this is where they distill the best liquor in the province and in Ecuador.

This is where Guadalupe lives.  She's 19 years old and single, and lives in her parents' house.  She's a very hardworking young woman who's getting the loan to help her parents by investing it in the family business.

They have a restaurant downtown where she and her mother prepare various dishes.  A lot of people go to their place every day to eat their delicious food.  They make breakfast and lunch, and on the weekend they also make supper.  The dish their customers prefer is the shellfish soup.  Their customers prefer them because of their delicious meals and their customer service.  

This loan is to buy provisions to prepare the dishes.

She has been in the communal bank for more than a year and she likes it because the loans are a big help.  Her dream is to get a college education, which she hasn't been able to do because she doesn't have enough money.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Mukthar

texts.en:
Ms. Mukthar is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. With the support of her husband, she has been running a general store for the last year. The man shown in the photo is Mukthar’s husband and they are happily working together to meet the needs of the family members.

In the beginning of her business, she faced many problems because of a lack of business knowledge and experience but they have improved their business with the support of Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 in order to purchase stock of rice and sugar, and packs of cleaning products. With the help of this loan, she can meet the increasing demands of her clients in order to generate more revenue. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her profits to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice and sugar, and packs of cleaning products.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms Shehnaz is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, at her house, for the past five years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market for the store's inventory, as he has maintained many contacts there, for years. Her husband also sells vegetables and fruits at the local market. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and healthcare.

Ms Shehnaz wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the loan to buy more inventory, like packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to satisfy the increasing demand at her store. She has been in association with Kashf since three years ago, and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business, in future.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, like packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to resell at her home-based store

loans.name: Raiza

texts.en:
Ms Raiza is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She has been sewing gloves for the past six years. She makes gloves at home and then sells them in the local market. She has built a regular list of customers and makes enough money to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family without her help. 

She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers she has requested a loan of Rs. 40000 to purchase cloth and more spools of threads as well as wool in various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Raiza wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and more spools of thread as well as wool in various colors.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Ms Bano is 27 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has a business of machine-embroidery for the past year. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. Business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Bano’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 20000, to buy spools of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and shiny material.  She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village. 

She would teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and shiny material.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Ms Sakeena is a 54 year old married woman and mother of six children. She has run a tailoring business for 12 years to support her husband. She has accepted the fact that if her husband is the only one working for their family, they will not be able to meet the household expenses. She started tailoring at home to help support her family. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide additional income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of Rs. 30000/- to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand without fail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Sakeena hopes to grow her business through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and lace.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Ms Najma is a married woman and the mother of two. Both of her children are in school  She has been running a business trading cloth for the last two years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become well-known for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Najma has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season taking into account the choices and taste of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales.  

She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season taking into account the choices and taste of her customers.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Mrs. Shahida is a 61-year-old housewife. She lives with her family in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven. She has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, which she will use for her grandson. He owns a cell phone accessories shop, in the market near his house. With the loan money, he will buy a variety of cell phone accessories, including, e.g., casings, mobile covers, chargers, handsfree, and sim cards. With the new inventory, the grandson will be able to satisfy his clients more professionally, and to increase his savings for a better future.

Mrs. Shahida is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her grandson. She prays for the huge success of her grandson, as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cell phone accessories, for her grandson's shop.

loans.name: Adriana Jessenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí vive la señora Adriana, tiene 26 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y 4 años los dos mayores estudian  en escuela.  El marido es chofer profesional.

Doña Adriana para ganar sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y para los estudios a sus hijos se dedica al  comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en sus ventas ya que los sábados y domingos también se dedica a preparar y vender  comida en su casa, ella pone un pequeño comedor en el cual vende desayunos y deliciosos almuerzos. Lleva con su negocio 6 años y que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños y víveres para preparar los alimentos. . Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le  gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Los Corrales meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales, a few minutes away from Montecristi. Most people there work in activities such as craftsmanship and trade in general. This is where Adriana lives. She is a 26-year old married woman and has three children, aged 11, 8 and 4. The two older kids attend school and her husband is a professional driver. 

With an aim to have her own financial resources and to help her husband with the household expenses and tuition for the kids, Adriana has her own business selling all kind of clothing items. She sells door to door Monday through Friday, and also cooks and sells food at her house on Saturdays and Sundays. She has a dining room where she offers breakfasts and delicious lunches. She has been in business for six years and things are going well. 

She will use the requested loan to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and food to prepare the meals. She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and she likes it because thanks to one of the loans received she could start her business. 

Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes and food.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Ms Humaira is 35 years old, a married woman, and a mother of five children. She has been running a beauty parlor business for the past two years. She very well knows the art of makeup and hair styling, and she earns enough to contribute to the family income.

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. For the improvement of her business, she has now applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. With this loan, she would be able to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities. She is hoping to cater to more customers, time after time.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 36 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the area of the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married and has six children, who are between 1 and 18  years old. All of them live at home, and five attend school. Marie, herself, was not fortunate enough to have attended school.

Marie has been selling red oil in the local market for the past four years. She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself. She learned this trade from her friends. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil to resell at her business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 25 years old, and a retail shop owner in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of one. She has been in the retail shop business for the past three years, doing well. Her husband earns additional income.

This marks Brenda's second borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase retail shop inventory, including wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and milk. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed in her business, in future.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop inventory, including wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en:
Ms Iffat is 53 years old and married. She has three children: two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is not working due to illness, so she started her business of sewing to contribute in the family income. She has gained five years of experience in this field and is very familiar with stitching techniques. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation and she used her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Currently, she requests a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of threads in different colours, as well as packs of buttons, needles, and zippers so that she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colours, as well as packs of buttons, needles, and zippers.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Ms Aneela is a 22-year-old married lady. For about 2 years, Aneela has been running a business of selling milk with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Aneela’s husband. 

She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way she would be able to cater more people in her community. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is 37 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is single with two children ages 10 and 13. They live at home and are in school. 

She was unable to attend school, and for four years now she has been selling lappa (traditional clothes) around her community and at the market. She started this business with small goods (lappa) from her friend as sell-pay (to take the goods on credit, sells the goods, pay the principle, and have the profit) and she learned this trade from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Ms Fouzia is 51 years old and a vigorous lady. She is a mother of five children. She has been stitching gentlemen's clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation.

She intends to use the loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues. In this way, she may be able to generate a healthier income. She is in her first loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Ms Naheed is 53 years old and a hard-working, married woman.  She has been engaged in a business of stitching, at home, for the past 16 years. She has made progress. She is married and has five children; all of the children are school-going. It’s hard to depend solely on the income of one's husband, so she started her business from a small level, to contribute to the family income. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers, and she makes enough to support the needs of the family members. Her daughters assist her in her business.

To fulfill the customers’ orders on time, she needs to purchase spools of thread and a new sewing machine. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She dreams of expanding her business, by opening a boutique in her community to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 53-year-old father of seven. After his retirement, he started working in a blacksmith business. One of Omar’s daughters is Bayan, who is attending a government university to pursue a bachelor's degree. Omar is applying for an education loan, to support his daughter and pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's next semester fees.

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en:
Izabella is from Yerevan. She lives with her husband and 20-year-old daughter. Izabella works at a local shop as a seller. Her husband is a driver for a local company. Their income is barely enough to cover the family’s basic expenses, and it doesn't allow them to save money for their daughter's education.

Izabella's daughter studies at Russian-Armenian Slavonic University and is in her third course. Izabella's daughter Elina dreams to become a good specialist and find a job with a salary that allows her to be financially independent. Izabella has requested this loan to pay for Elina's university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora  Magdalena, tiene 45 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad y la menor tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio y es la única que vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Magdalena es una gran ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y salir adelante  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a  puerta y también vende en su casa lugar donde tiene su mercadería a disposición de sus clientes, vende al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo en dos pagos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 15h00, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil una vez por mes ya que allá hay más variedad y  más barato. Lleva en este negocio por más de 6 años y  gracias a sus ganancias ella puede pagar los estudios de su hija. 

Este crédito es para compra zapatos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y que su hija sea una gran profesional
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Los Corrales" (The Corrals) meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, where the majority of people make a living in different activities such as crafts and general trade.

Magdalena, 45, lives here. She has a common law marriage and has four children with her partner, three of whom are older and the youngest is 17 and studying in high school. She is the only one that lives with Magdalena. Magdalena's husband is a merchant

Magdalena is a great housewife that, in order to be able to earn something for her own account and get ahead, makes a living selling shoes and beads. She sells door to door and also sells from her home where she has her merchandise available to her clients. She sells in cash and credit, with a two payment maximum. She works every day from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month since there are cheaper prices and more variety there. 

She has been running this business for six years and thanks to her earnings, she is able to pay for her daughter's studies. This loan is for the purchase of shoes and beads. She has been part of the Community Bank since its beginnings and she likes it for the help she receives from the bank. Her dreams are to improve her home and that her daughter become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes and beads

loans.name: Rosa Stella

texts.es:
Ella es Rosa Stella Triana Fernández tiene 18 años, su familia está conformada por 3 hermanos, su mamá y un sobrino ella es la menor, su papá murió hace 12 años cuando ella tan solo tenía 7 años, sufrio mucho por la pérdida de su padre, pero lo fue superando con el tiempo, su  mamá los sacó adelante con mucho sacrificio por que hizo de papá y mamá en una etapa muy difícil que fue el crecimiento de ellos, hoy en día son unas personas consientes de la vida con metas y proyectos en mente para ahora ser ellos los que ayuden a su mamá, rosa le da gracias a su madre por estarle pagando su estudio y apoyándola en lo que a ella le gusta, porque eso es lo que ellos necesitan para poder salir adelante una familia que les de concejos y alientos para culminar sus proyectos, quiere ser una buena enfermera tener méritos en su trabajo y destacarse por lo que hace y por su forma de ser, uno de sus sueños es conocer muchos países y culturas diferentes y también quiere estudiar inglés para ir a trabajar a Estados Unidos y tener una buena estabilidad económica, ahora que su mamá no vive con ella se ha dado cuenta que no es nada fácil porque, rosa acostumbrada a verla todos los días, pero eso la hace más fuerte y valorar  más a su madre, está más pendiente de ella, rosa cree que para algunas personas es aterrador que su mamá se allá ido de la casa, y pensaran que se fue por problemas en el hogar y no es así, su  mamá lo hizo para que ellos se hicieran más responsables de sus cosas y de la casa que su papá les dejó, y si, ella se ha dado cuenta que se han hecho cargo de la casa eso para ella es muy chévere, puede decir que tiene la familia más hermosa porque son muy unidos y están más  pendientes uno del otro y la mamá más hermosa porque los quiere y los cuida mucho y espera que siga así por muchos años más.
Con este técnico tendrá un futuro asegurado y la satisfacción de que su tiempo no fue desperdiciado si no aprovechado para su desarrollo personal e integral y seguir estudiando en esta área de la salud que es lo que a ella le gusta hacer ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus cuidados.
texts.en:
Rosa Stella Triana Fernández is 18 years old.  Her family is comprised of three siblings, her mother, and a nephew who is the youngest.  Her father died twelve years ago when she was only seven years old.  She suffered greatly from the loss of her father but overcame it with time.  It took a great deal of sacrifice for her mom to get them ahead because she became both mother and father in that very difficult period when they were growing up. Today, they are individuals who are aware of life’s challenges and have goals and projects in mind to now be the ones to help their mother.  Rosa gives thanks to her mother for paying for her studies and supporting her in what she loves because that’s what they need to get ahead: a family that advises and encourages them to fulfill their plans. She wants to be a good nurse, have merit in her work, and stand out because of what she does and the kind of person that she is.   One of her dreams is to learn about many different countries and cultures. She also wants to study English in order to work in the United States and have good financial stability.  

Now that her mother is no longer living with her, she realizes that nothing is easy because she was accustomed to seeing her every day.  But this makes her stronger and makes her value her mother more, and she is more considerate of her.  Rosa realizes that the fact that her mother left home is frightening to some people, and they think that she left because there were problems in the home, but it isn’t so.  Her mother did it to make them more responsible for their belongings and for the house that their father left them.  Yes, she realizes that having taken charge of the house is very exciting for her.  She can say that she has the most beautiful family because they are very united and very dependent on each other and their mother is the most beautiful because she loves and cares for them very much and she expects that this will remain so for many more years.  

With this degree, she will have a secure future and the satisfaction that she did not waste her time, but rather she made the most of it for her personal and overall development.  In addition, continuing her studies in the health care field will enable her to do what she enjoys: helping people in need of her care.

loans.use: to complete her degree.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia Encarnación pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III,la socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion y compra y venta de artesania,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.


La socia Encarnación solicita el préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca para elaborar chompas para su negocio.


La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Encarnación belongs to the "Comuzone III" community bank. She continues with her business making, buying and selling handicrafts. The business is having a good time with the business, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She wishes to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family. Encarnación is requesting the loan to purchase alpaca wool to make sweaters for her business. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool to make sweaters.

loans.name: Yhury

texts.es:
El socio Yhury pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III,el socio continua con su negocio de deposito de cerveza el cual vende las 24 horas del dia,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Yhury belongs to the Comuzone III community bank and continues to run his small beer store, selling 24 hours a day. He is having a good time with the business, which is going well thanks to the hard work he puts into it every day. He wishes to continue working and in this way continue supporting his family. He is requesting the loan to purchase beer for his business. He feels grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase beer for his business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.es:
La socia Stella continua con su negocio de cafeteria,la socia lleva años en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende te,cafe con leche,tortas ,galletas,entre otros,la socia tambien continua dedicandose a la venta de productos de belleza,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes y colonias para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Stella continues running her cafe, which she has had for a number of years and is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day selling tea, coffee with milk, sandwiches, cookies and other items. She also continues to dedicate herself to selling beauty products, and in this way she makes headway for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase perfumes and colognes. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
El Señor Juan habita en una de las comarcas del municipio Nagarote desde hace mas de 31 años dedicándose a la crianza de la ganadería y al cultivo de maíz y pastos, con lo cual el sobrevive con su familia, actualmente es su tercer crédito que tiene con ceprodel,esta vez lo solicita  para la compra de terneros para crianza y engorde.

los créditos anterior los a utilizado en la mejora de potreros y corales.
texts.en:
Juan has lived in a a community in the town of Nagarote for more than 31 years. He raises cattle and grown corn and grass to support his family. Right now, this is his third loan with Ceprodel. This time, he is asking for it to buy calves to raise and fatten. 

The previous loans were used to improve the pastures and the pens.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Napoleón Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Napoleón Eduardo vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 11 años. es una persona responsable con su familia.

El señor napoleón está solicitando a kiva un crédito para  gastos médicos, exámenes de laboratorio   y compra de medicamento  de su madre  ya que se encuentra delicada de salud
texts.en:
Napoleón Eduardo lives in the city of Managua. He has worked as a security guard for 11 years. He is a responsible person with his family.

Napoleón is asking for a Kiva loan for medical expenses, laboratory tests and to buy medications for his mother because she is in poor health.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Edgardo Geovanny

texts.es:
El Señor  Edgardo presta una activad de sonido lo cual realiza perifoneo, ameniza fiesta infantiles, juveniles realiza perifoneo de anuncios publicitario y otros.

 actualmente el necesita invertir en compra de parlantes y una planta generadora de energía para la actividad que realiza ambulante, don Edgardo es su tercer crédito con ceprodel y se siente agradecido por la ayuda que le hemos brindado ya que se la mejorado su condición de vida de el y su familia en la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgardo's activity is a loudspeaker service for children's and youth's parties, advertising and more. 

Right now, he needs to invest in buying some speakers and a generator for his portable service. This is  Edgardo's third loan with Ceprodel and he is grateful for the help that we have given him. Expanding his business has improved his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy six large 1,800 watt speakers and other items.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Зариф 32 года. Он женат на прекрасной и умной женщине, которая является преподавателям в средней школе. Он имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Детям 5 и 3 года. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 5 лет он занимается предоставлением услугу перевозки со своим грузовиком. Он с бизнесом справляется один и с легкостью управляет им. Много людей строят дома в его районе и поэтому он имеет своих постоянных клиентов, которые покупают строительные материалы и используют услугу Зарифа. Зариф тоже хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом старый и имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, краски, древесину и т.п. Он надеется на ваше милосердие и верит, что этот займ поможет ему решить проблему жилья.
texts.en:
Zarif is 32 years old.  He is married to a beautiful and intelligent woman who is a high school teacher.  He has two young children: a five-year-old and a three-year-old.

In order to provide his family with all the necessities of life, Zarif has been offering transportation services, using his own truck, for more than five years.  He works alone and manages his business without any difficulty.  A lot of people are building houses in his area, so Zarif has many regular customers who buy building materials and then use his transportation services.

Zarif also wants to repair his house, which is old and in poor condition.  He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, paints, wood etc.

He relies on your compassion and believes that this loan will help him to solve his housing problem.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paint and wood to repair his house.

loans.name: Cesar Cástulo

texts.es:
Don Cesar Cástulo vive en un municipio de Managua donde habita con su familia desde hace cincuenta y ocho años, se desempeña como Higienista en una empresa del estado, desde hace veinte año  que labora para dicha institución, es viudo con una persona a su cargo. 

Esta solicitando crédito a CEPRODEL, para realizar  gastos de compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, bloque para levantar pared nueva ya que esta en mal estado y necesita repararla para tener  seguridad en su vivienda.

Don Cesar Cástulo necesita este financiamiento para poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y espera el apoyo de estos organismos que ayudan a persona de bajos recursos económicos, ya que con su salario solo alcanza para el sustento de la alimentación.
texts.en: Cesar has lived in the municipality of Managua with his family for the past 58 years. He has worked as hygienist for a state company for the past 20 years. He is a widower with one person under his care. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner CEPRODEL to pay for construction materials like sand, cement and bricks to put up a new wall, since the current one is in bad condition and Cesar needs to repair it to make his home safer. He is requesting this loan to be able to improve his family's standard of living and awaits the support from organizations like this one that helps people with few economic resources, since his salary is only enough for sustenance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Neylan Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Neylan trabaja para el Preescolar del municipio de  Nagarote  desde hace 2 años.

solicita este  crédito para compra de ladrillos, cementos, perniles y otos para mejorar su vivienda.

Ella lleva dos años trabajando con ceprodel la cual se siente agradecida por la ayuda que siempre le brinda ceprodel y ha logrado mejorar un poco la condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Neylan has worked at a preschool in the municipality of Nagarote for the past two years. She is requesting the loan to purchase bricks, cement, beams and other supplies to make improvements to her home. She has been with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for two years and feels grateful for the support the organization always provides to help her improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, beams and other supplies.

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima labora para el centro de salud desde hace 6 años como conserje, el crédito lo solicito para compra de zinc, cementos, ladrillos y otros,  para hacerle mejoras a su casa y brindarle mas seguridad a sus hijos. 

ella se siente agradecida por la ayuda que siempre le brinda ceprodel.
texts.en: Fátima has worked as a caretaker at a health center for the past six years. She is requesting the loan to purchase zinc sheets, cements, bricks and other supplies to make improvements to her home and provide her children with more security. She feels grateful for the help that Kiva partner CEPRODEL always provides.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets, cement, bricks and other supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аиде 39 лет, имеет 2 детей. Аида 10 месяцев назад открыла продуктовый павильон, начав с суммы (KGS) 100,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, ее товарооборот увеличился в два раза. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аида обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) , целью которого является покупка стойматериалов для постройки скалада для ячменя и отрубей, так как на эти товары имеется стабильный спрос.  Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса,  и мечтает об открытии своей второй точки торговли.
texts.en:
Aida is 39 years old and she has two children.  Ten months ago, she opened a grocery store, using an initial capital of 100,000 som.  Thanks to her hard work, she has managed to double her turnover.

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to the micro-finance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy building materials for the construction of a warehouse to store bran and barley, because she receives a steady demand for both goods.

Aida plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.  She also dreams about opening a second store.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a warehouse.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth,pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de plasticos y productos desechables,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio ,la socia  cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de platos,vasos,jarras de plasticos para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Yaneth belongs to the Comuzone III community bank and continues to run her business selling plastics and disposable products. She is having a good time with her business, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She has a store where she sells the merchandise her customers demand. Yaneth wants to be able to continue working and in this way she can keep supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase plastic plates, cups and jugs for her business. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase plastic plates, cups and jugs.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон очень добродушный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 8 детей. Абдурахмон очень упорно трудится, чтобы обеспечить свою большую семью. Жена Абдурахмона домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Абдурахмон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Он более 13 лет занимается услуги такси. Он перевозит людей с одной точки района в другую. Он имеет большой опыт и предоставляет услугу такси на высшем уровне. Абдурахмон тратит все свои заработанные деньги для обеспечения семьи. Недавно у него сломалась машина, но он не имеет денег для ремонта. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для ремонта машины. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему развевать бизнес и увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon is  a very good-natured and determined man.  He is married, raises 8 children, and works very hard to support his large family.  His wife is a homemaker and she takes care of the children.  Abdurahmon is the only bread-winner in his family.

Abdurahmon has been providing taxi services for more than 13 years, transporting people throughout his district.  He is very experienced and provides a very high quality of service.  He spends all his income to support his family.

Not long ago, Abdurhamon's car broke down, but he doesn't have any money to repair it.  He is requesting a loan of $550 to repair his car.  He is relying on your kindness.  This loan will help him to develop his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 28 лет. У нее двое маленьких детей. Сайёра проживает в Гиссарском районе в центрально-западной части страны. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках за границей. Сайёра тоже наравне мужа работает и обеспечивает семью. Уже два года как Сайёра работает в сфере торговли. На рынке своего района у нее имеется собственная торговая точка, где она занимается продажей хлеба и продуктов питания. Сайёра очень любит свою деятельность и не может представить себя вне сферы торговли. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
