Sayora, aged 28, is a young married woman with two small children. She lives in the Gissar district, located in the central-western part of Tajikistan.  Her husband is currently working abroad.

Just like her husband, Sayora also works in order to provide for her family.  She has been involved in retail for two years now, and owns a retail outlet at her district market.  She sells bread and other food products.  Sayora loves her job and cannot imagine not being involved in retail.  

She is taking a loan to increase her turnover of goods.

loans.use: to buy bread and other food products to increase her turnover of goods.

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 43 años de edad es casado  tiene  dos  hijos  que dependen de él,  vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la venta de agua  en fardos, botellón y jugos de distintos sabores.
Don Santos vende sus productos en escuelas, centros básicos y personas que a diario visita,  viaja en su carro a las comunidades a vender este producto.
Don Santos es un hombre esforzado que día a día lucha por salir adelante con sus hijos los cuales están estudiando.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra tambos con agua y jugos al por mayor porque en esta temporada la demanda es grande, por tal razón desea almacenar suficiente producto.
Don Santos espera que con la inversión mejore un poco  su economía y también su negocio, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Don Santos Su sueño es cambiar su carro para así visitar más lugares.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Santos is 43 years old, married and has two children who depend on him.  He lives in a San Lorenzo community, in a valley in southern Honduras.  He has a home of his own and has been selling bottles and jugs of water and different kinds juices for five years.  He sells his products in schools, population centers, and to people he visits daily.  He travels by car around the community to sell his products.

Santos puts forth a lot of effort daily and works hard to get ahead with his children who attend school.

Santos is asking for this loan to buy drums of water and juices in quantity because this is the high demand season and he wants to stock up on merchandise.

Santos hopes that this investment will improve his finances and his business.  He is very happy to continue to work with Prisma.  His dream is to change his car so he can visit more locations.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2013.

loans.use: to buy water and juices.

loans.name: Simona Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Simona  de  51  años de edad es madre soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 13 años  a la venta de abarrotería hace unos 03 años que cambio de rubro hoy se dedica a la venta de golosinas, frescos y comida.
Doña Simona sus clientes le prefieren por su atención y buen trato, es una mujer sola que lucha día con día por tener una mejor vida.
Doña Simona está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos por mayor, papas, yuca, plátanos verdes, cebollas, chiles verdes, repollo, remolacha,  que son lo que necesita para atender mejor a sus clientes, tiene bastante demanda de sopa de pescado y frescos de botella.
Doña Simona está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es tener su propia casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2013
texts.en:
Simona is 51 years old and a single mother, but she doesn’t have any children who depend on her for support.  She lives in San Lorenzo, in a valley in southern Honduras.  She doesn’t have a home of her own.  She sold groceries for 13 years, but 3 years ago she changed fields and now sells snacks, soft drinks, and food.

Simona and her customers like the attention and good service she gives.  She works daily to have a better life.

Simona is asking for this loan to buy soft drinks such as potatoes, yucca, green plantains, onions, green peppers, cabbage, beets, which she needs to provide better service to her customers.  She has a high demand for fish soup and bottled drinks.

Simona is very happy to continue working with Prisma and she wants to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Zaragosa

texts.es:
La socia Zaragosa pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE III,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de golosinas ,la socia cuenta con un kiosko donde vende su mercaderia  a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.


La socia Zaragosa solicita el préstamo para la compra de más golosinas como galletas y chupetines.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Zaragosa, belongs the Comuzone III communal bank.  She's still making a living in her business selling sweets.  She has a kiosk where she sells her merchandise to her customers.

She has had her business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She wants to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

Zaragosa's requesting the loan to buy more sweets such as cookies and lollipops.

She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy sweets such as cookies and lollipops

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 31-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and five children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business as the demand of his clients is increasing day by day. Therefore his wife Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, oils etc. to cope with the increased demand of clients. 

Lubna and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia tiene 46 años, estudio tan solo hasta el nivel primario y se casó con el señor Víctor, tienen tres hijos, el mayor no pudo ingresar a la universidad por su situación económica, por tal razón el hijo mayor se fue a trabajar a Brasil, actualmente el hijo mayor colabora con los estudios universitarios a su segundo hermano, la menor está cursando el nivel primario en una escuela fiscal de la zona. La señora vivió con sus padres a los cuales colaboró en la producción agrícola durante la niñez, una vez que se casó le dieron su herencia donde actualmente vive con su familia en la zona de Caramarca, es una de las zonas de mayor producción de cebolla, maíz, papa y otros; como esta zona es apta para el rubro la familia se dedica al sembrado de maíz, papa y cebolla. En este mes comienza el sembrado de papa pero la señora Alicia no cuenta con efectivo para comprar la semilla y abono, es por esto que solicita el crédito. De esta manera la señora Alicia ayudara a sus dos hijos menores para que puedan salir profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Alicia is 46 years old and has only a primary school education. She is married to Sr. Víctor and they have three children. Her oldest child was not able to enroll at the university because of their financial situation. Therefore, he went to Brazil in order to work. He currently contributes to the university studies of the middle child. The youngest is attending a state primary school in the area.

Alicia’s parents worked in agriculture when she was a child. When she got married, they gave her an inheritance. She and her family currently live in the District of Caramarca, one of the areas that produces large amounts of onions, corn, potatoes, and other crops. Like any other area, her land is suitable for facilitating the family business of planting corn, potatoes, and onions. Alicia will begin planting potatoes this month, but she does not have the cash to buy seeds and compost. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. This will allow her to help her two youngest children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 45-year-old widow. Her husband drowned in a lake in 2012, and she was left with the responsibility of looking after six school-going children. After realizing that relying solely on agriculture could not meet her day-to-day needs, she started selling clothes to supplement her seasonal income from agriculture. Currently, Joy boasts of serving as a role model widow who has been able to pay her children’s school fees up to the university level. 

Joy currently faces a challenge of limited working capital, since most of her children have reached high school and the money withdrawn from the business to pay tuition now affects her capital. She has therefore applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 but is being granted only  UGX 1,000,000 to buy cow dung to mulch her banana plantation. She will use the surplus to boost her working capital. She is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy cow dung to mulch her banana plantation

loans.name: Kwekulakulanya Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 34 years old and a single mother of an 11-year-old child, who goes to school.  

She started a charcoal business six years ago, after her husband had abandoned her and he did not want to cater for the family. As a mother, she would not sit back and look at her child’s future getting spoiled without an education and all the basic needs, therefore, she saved some money to start up the business.

Because of her hard work, Harriet has managed to save her little profit and has bought a piece of land where she has started construction of a small, permanent, residential house for herself and her child. With the loan that she will be given, she will be able to buy construction materials for the same purpose.

Harriet has dreams of expanding her business, educating her child, and getting her own home. Harriet’s challenge is having limited capital for her business. Harriet’s neighbors and workmates, when approached, described her as a courageous, hard-working, and cooperative lady in society. She is confident that, with the Ugafode loan, her dreams will soon be realized.

loans.use: to buy building materials to begin construction of her house.

loans.name: Elsi Varinia

texts.es:
La socia Elsi Varinia tiene 38 años de edad es osltera y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de utiles de escritorio y libreria,la socia vende lapiceros,cuadernos y libros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de libreria y utiles de escritorio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar libros,cuadernos y lapiceroa.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elsi Varinia is 38 years old, single, and has two children. She manages a writing supplies shop and a bookstore. Elsi sells pens, notebooks, and books. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. Elsi has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her bookstore and her writing supplies business.

Elsi is requesting a loan in order to buy books, notebooks, and pens. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Amanecer De Los Inkas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMANECER DE LOS INKAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Estefania (es la socia que levanta la mano) ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 9 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo se retiro del banco comunal Amanecer de los inkas
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "AMANECER DE LOS INKAS" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Estefania (the one with her hand up) is 53 years old, married and has nine children.  She runs a grocery store from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. selling essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  In her free time she enjoys going out for walks.  Her goal is to expand her grocery store and she is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The person with her face covered in the photo is no longer with the communal bank.  The other members are involved in activities such as vegetable sales, beauty product sales, grocery store business and food sales.

Estefania is grateful to the lenders helping her and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: La Gran Alianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA GRAN ALIANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Rosa ella es soltera y tiene 22 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría  a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante con su negocio.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, imprenta, cevicheria, crianza de animales menores, sastrería, venta de golosinas, mueblería.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "LA GRAN ALIANZA" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members, Rosa, is 22 years old and single, and she alternates her daily activities with her business selling small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  For some time now she has been in business and it is going well thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day.  Rosa raises small animals and then sells them to customers on an order basis.  She hopes to continue working so her business can prosper.  She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for the business.

The other members of the group are involved in crafts, printing, ceviche (food) business, raising small animals, tailor business, sweets sales and furniture making.  The person with her face covered is no longer in the group.

Rosa is grateful to everyone who is helping her reach her goal and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, esta ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra.Dianet ella es separada ,tiene 38 años de edad y  tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría  a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante con su negocio.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida, peluquería, venta de alpaca, crianza de animales menores, venta de leche, venta de verduras, maestro constructor.

La foto fue tomada en dos grupos ya que el segundo grupo (ubicado a la derecha) pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The communal bank "WIÑAY KURY" is located in the district of Quiquijana, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

One of the members, Dianet, is 38 years old, divorced and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, etc., and has been in business for quite some time.  It is going well thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day.  She raises small animals that she later sells to customers on an order basis.  She hopes to continue working so her business will prosper and is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members of the group are involved in activities such as a grocery store business, food sales, hair salon, alpaca sales, raising small animals, milk sales, vegetable sales, and master construction worker.

The photos are of two groups because the second group (at the right) had to arrive late because of work.

Dianet is grateful to everyone helping her reach her goal and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Arabella

texts.es:
La joven Arabella reside en el casco urbano dela Ciudad de Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera departamental de Estelí, ella es soltera y reside en su propia casa de habitación.

Esta joven es maestra y a diario imparte clases a niños en un colegio de primaria en la misma ciudad de Condega, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de las 7 am las 12 m y por la tarde ella planifica su clase del día siguiente, y los fines de semana esta joven se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo y de esta manera tener un ingreso extra.

Esta clienta se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar unas mejorar en su vivienda, ella piensa comprar varias laminas de zinc para el mantenimiento del techo de su casa así como para la compra de cemento y afinar las paredes de su casa y el pago de mano de obra de los albañiles.

 Cabe mencionar que esta clienta es el crédito numero cuatro que ella solicita ya que sus ingresos mensuales no le dan para asumir por cuenta propia el gasto del mejoramiento de su casa de habitación y espera que dicho financiamiento le sea aprobado ya que se aproxima la época lluviosa y pretende tener en buenas condiciones su casa. Ella se muestra agradecida con Ceprodel ya que los financiamientos anteriores le han permitido ir mejorando su vivienda y así teniendo un techo mas digno.
texts.en:
Arabella is a young woman who lives in the urban area of the city of Condega which is about 35 kms north of the head department of Estelí.  She is single and lives in her own house.

This young lady is a teacher at an elementary school in the city of Condega, where she works Monday through Friday, from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon.  In the afternoods she plans her classes for the next day and on weekends sells beauty products by catalogue to make extra income.

This borrower came to the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house.  She is planning to buy zinc metal sheeting for maintenance of her roof, as well as cement for the walls of her house.  She will also hire workers to do the job.

It is worth mentioning that this is her fourth loan and she is requesting it because her monthly income is not enough to cover the full renovation cost.  She hopes the loan will be approved because the rainy season is approaching and she wants to have her house ready by then.  She is very grateful to Ceprodel because the previous loan also helped with her home renovation so she could have a decent roof over her head.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and cement, and to hire workers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio vive en la cuidad de Managua casado trabaja en el área de mantenimiento en un centro de compra  de la capital desde hace 20 años.

Muy responsable en sus tarea laborales, Silvio está solicitando un crédito para hacerles  un anexo en su casa para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Agradece mucho a kiva y ceprodel por que los créditos que le han otorgado los ha utilizado para mejorar poco a poco su casa
texts.en:
Silvio lives in the city of Managua.  He is married and has been working in the maintenance area of a shopping center in the capital city for over 20 years.

Silvio, who is very responsible in his work, is requesting a loan to expand his house to improve living conditions.

He is very grateful for Kiva and Ceprodel for the loans he has received and used to renovate his house little by little.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This marks Emily's fourth loan to purchase poultry mash and chicks for rearing in her increased chicken brood. 

She has previously serviced her loans well and is very hopeful that she will continue to get funds for her poultry farm at any time from KADET. 

She hopes to increase her supply of chicks further to be able to satisfy her clients and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase poultry mash and chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 34-year-old mother of three girls and a boy. Her husband already works in two jobs to make a living. 

Fatmeh has started to help too by opening a small store selling food products and sometimes home products. 

Now, she is applying for a loan to bring more goods to her store and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bring more goods to her store

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is 35 years old and a resident of Kasubi located in the suburbs of the city. He has four children, who all attend school. He dropped out of school at the secondary level due to a lack of school fees and then started running small businesses.

Tadeo deals in the business of jewellery and other small items, which he started in 2008 with the aim of improving his daily income and through this has been able to take care of himself and his family. However, his business could not grow due to a lack of capital. 

He would like to get a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to add more stock to his business and enable him to expand and meet all the client's demands.

Tadeo’s dream is to expand his business and even to be able to sell on a wholesale basis. He would also like to get a shop, where he can stage his business and stop selling from the veranda. He also wants to finish his residential house.

Tadeo faces the difficulty of inadequate capital and competition also affects him. He is such a hard working man and he is very committed to his business.

He thanks UGAFODE for giving him support towards fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a 46-year-old mother of one daughter. She lives in Yerevan with her husband and 18-year-old daughter, who studies at Yerevan State University in the Department of Management.

Gohar is a seller at a local shop and, together with her husband, she works hard to gather income and sustain her family. 

Unfortunately, it is very difficult for Gohar to cover the family's costs and at the same time save money for her daughter’s education. So, Gohar has requested this loan from SEF International to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

The loan is very important for this whole family. Gohar dreams that daughter will become a good specialist and be financially independent in the future.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 30 years old. He lives in a small village in the Ozurgeti District with his parents. 

Lasha has requested several loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request has been rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. Specifically, they have two milking cows, two calves and two pigs. Besides this, they have ten beehives with bee colonies and a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees and maize are grown. They sell the harvested products, like honey and cheese, at the local markets. 

Lasha has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lasha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Lasha will purchase a festive tent and all the equipment needed, which can be used at different kinds of events. He will rent it out to the other villagers and generate income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a festive tent to rent out

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora socorro vive en la cuidad de managua se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde trabajadora muy querida en su barrio por sus vecinos tiene un hijo en edad escolarya  que su mayor sueño es ver a su hijo todo un profesional.

es por eso que trabaja día a día vendiendo lotería ambulante y también comercializa producto de ambientadores  para el hogar ya que considera que esto le va ayudar a incrementar sus ganancia para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y pago de estudio para su hijo.

es por esta razón que esta solicitando un crédito a kiva  para la compra de esencia de ambientador para ofertarle a su clientes en diferentes aromas
texts.en:
Socorro lives in the city of Managua. She is described as a humble, hardworking person who is beloved by her neighbors. She has a school aged son and her biggest dream is t see him have a good career.

That is why she works day to day selling lottery as a street vendor. She also sells air freshener products for the home. She believes that this will help her increase her earnings to improve her quality of life and pay for her son's education.

That is why she is asking for a Kiva loan to buy sir freshener essence to offer her customers different scents.

loans.use: to buy air fresheners.

loans.name: Juana Danelia

texts.es:
Juana Danelia de 31  años, casado con dos hijos de 13, 9 años de edad. Es originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de Managua, Danelia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbres con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos y prepararles comidas típicas de  la región como indio viejo. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, por eso lucha  día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su espíritu, y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de queques. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  comprar materia prima como moldes, azúcar, crema, arina huevos, leche, canela, chantillí, levadura, velas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Juana Danelia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana Danelia is 31 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 9. She is from Managua, located in central  Managua. Danelia is described as being a hardworking, responsible woman with good habits and who really wants to get ahead personally. In her free time, she likes to enjoy her children and make them traditional foods from the region, such as indio viejo. Unfortunately, she was unable to go to school due to a lack of financial resources. That is why she fights day to day to offer them a better future. 

Thanks to her sprit and her eagerness to get ahead, she has the economic activity of making and selling cakes. She spends about 10 hours a day on her business, and activity she performs with much pleasure. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and buy raw materials such as molds, sugar, cream, flour, eggs, milk, cinnamon, chantilly cream, yeast, and candles so that in the near future she can obtain better income. Juana Danelia is grateful for the help the Kiva investors give to low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua ao that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy raw materials to make cakes such as molds, sugar, cream, flour, eggs, milk, cinnamon, chantilly cream, yeast and candles.

loans.name: Banco Comunal En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal en Dios confiamos está conformado por 10 integrantes, 8 mujeres y 2 dos, madres y padres responsables con 25 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ello son personas trabajaras, responsables, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar sus estudios, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde muy temprana edad. Por eso luchan día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

La coordinadora del banco comunal  En Dios confiamos es María Matilde, gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboración venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto por que ha sido la forma de vida y su familia. Ellas dedican a su actividad unas 10 horas días. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como maíz, Lena, gas, bolsas plásticas, comal. Fosforo. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  En Dios Confiamos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The En Dios Confiamos communal bank is made up of 10 members- 8 women and 2 men. They are responsible men and women with 25 children under their care. They are hardworking, responsible people. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, they were unable to go to school and they had to work from a very young age. That is why they fight day to day to offer a better future to their children.

The En Dios Confiamos communal bank coordinator is María Matilde. Thanks to her spirit and her eagerness to get ahead, she has an economic activity of selling tortillas from her house. She does this activity with a lot of pleasure because it is her and her family's way of life. She works at this activity for around 10 hours a day. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital buy buying raw materials such as corn, firewood, gas, plastic bags, a griddle and phosphorous so that in the near future she can make more income. The En Dios Confiamos communal bank is grateful to the Kiva investors for the help they offer low income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy raw materials such as corn, firewood, gas, plastic bags, and a griddle and phosphorous to make tortillas.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 39-year-old hardworking and enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and 3 children. Her husband's monthly net income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shakeela is trying to help him fulfill their needs by providing stitching services in her community. She is an excellent and efficient tailor by profession and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. 

For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to provide tailoring services.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a 47-year-old cafeteria owner in Kisimani, Mombasa. He is a married father of three children. He has been in this business for the last seven years and has done great.

This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase milk, sugar, new utensils and additional furniture for his cafeteria, and the anticipated profit will service his loan. He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, new utensils and additional furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some raw materials.

loans.name: Kwaku's Group

texts.en:
Kwaku's Group is made up of Kwasi, Henrietta, Eric, Charles, Juliet and Kwaku, and they are into the sales of secondhand clothing and underwear.

Kwaku is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Dansoman. He has been selling secondhand clothing at the market for the past two years.  He also receives support from his wife who also sells secondhand clothing, not jointly with Kwaku but separately. The apartment his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and is in need of some serious repair and insulation. 

He is requesting a loan of GHS 400 to purchase secondhand clothing so that he can make enough profit that, together with his wife, he can start renovations so that they can provide comfortable accommodations for their children. 

They need a total amount of GHS 2,400 to be able to sell enough to take care of their family.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel de 51 años de edad soltera con tres hijos, es originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de Nicaragua, ella se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora con ganas de superación personal. En su ratos libre le gusta disfrutar en familia con sus hijos, prepárales una comida típica como gallo pinto. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar estudios por falta de recursos económicos, se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta mercadería en general como: camisas, camisetas, faldas, pantalones, sandalias, ropa de cama, vestidos, pillamas, ropa de niño. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  María Isabel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Isabel is fifty-one years old and is a single mother of three children.  She is originally from Managua, a place that is located in the central zone of Nicaragua.  She is characterized as being a responsible and hardworking person with a desire for self-improvement.  In her free moments, she likes to enjoy time with her children, preparing typical foods for them, like rice and beans.  Unfortunately, she could not study due to lack of economic resources; she was obligated to work from a young age in order to help with home expenses.

Thanks to her spirit of self-improvement and her desire to get ahead, she works selling general merchandise like: blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, sandals, bedding, dresses, pajamas, and children's clothing.  She dedicates some ten hours a day to this activity, which she performs with a lot of enjoyment.  

The goal of her loan is to invest in working capital and to supply her business so that in the not too distant future, she can have a better income.  María Isabel is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to people from scarce backgrounds and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business in buying and selling clothing with items like blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, sandals, bedding, dresses, pajamas, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantation in Liberia. Massa is living together with her fiancée and twelve-year-old child who is in school. She is a high school graduate, and for four years now she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in the local market. 

She started this business with small goods from her friends as sell-pay (to take the goods on credit, sell the goods, pay the principle and have the profit) and she learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business. She plans to build up her child's future by educating him.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 26-year-old mother of 4 kids. While her husband works in a hotel to make a living, Manal sells clothes and a few types of home products at home to friends and neighbors. Now Manal is applying for a youth loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes and kitchenware.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchenware.

loans.name: Zulpigar

texts.en:
Zulpigar is 46 years old. He lives in Marneuli district with his wife and daughter. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has a grocery shop. They buy products from the local markets at a low cost and sell it from the shop with a price mark up. Zulpigar and his wife are working in the shop themselves so they don’t have to pay a salary to the seller, in order to have better profit. 

Zulpigar requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, he will purchase a dentist chair and all the needed equipment for this field. As Zulpigar is a professional dentist, he will have a good numbers of clients. He plans to work from his house so he doesn’t have to pay rent. This will decrease his expenses and increase his profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a dentist chair and all the other needed equipment.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 29-year-old motorcycle operator in Mariakani, Mombasa. He is a married man who supports three school-going children. He has been in the business for the last three years and has done great.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to service his motorcycle and purchase new tires. The anticipated profit will be used to open a greengrocer shop for his new venture. He hopes to succeed in all his businesses in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase new tires.

loans.name: Kpannah

texts.en:
Kpannah is 40 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with six children between 2 and 19 years old. All of them live at home and only five attend school. She was not fortunate enough to attend school.

She has been selling red oil in the local market for the past six years. She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself and learned this trade from friends. Kpannah is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Mrs. Anwar is a 55-year-old hardworking housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession, which is the only source of income for the family. However, currently he is not able to generate any income from the rickshaw, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Mrs. Anwar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to meet the cost of repairing the rickshaw's engine. She desires to provide quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the engine of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is from Kapan town where she lives with her husband (in the photo) and son. Satenik works at a local school as a teacher. As she had no opportunity to get higher education when she was young, now she works as a teacher without an educational background. Satenik applied to university last year. Now she is in the second course, studying primary education pedagogy. The salary she earns from teaching at school is barely enough to make ends meet. It is very difficult for her to cover her family’s costs and save money for her education. Satenik has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for Satenik to make her dream come true and have a higher education degree.

loans.use: pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 54 years old, married to Harrison, and a mother of six. She is a dairy farmer. She has been in this business for 14 years and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This will be Agnes' fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer, maize seedlings and insecticides. 

In future, she wants to be a successful farmer and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings  and insecticides.

loans.name: Masek

texts.en: Masek is 28 years old and married. He supports a family of three children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 12,000. He is servicing his second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Leparakuo

texts.en:
Leparakuo is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of five. He has been a maize farmer for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 14,000. 

He is servicing his second loan of KES. 45,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old. She lives in the Zestaponi district with her 31-year-old husband and two daughters (7 and 10 years old). Natia has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of income for the family is Natia’s husband’s monthly salary. He is working at the local iron factory as an artisan. Natia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Natia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Natia will purchase clothes from the big market in the capital city. She will bring the clothes to her district and sell them with the price markup among her villagers. This will give Natia an opportunity to earn an additional income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and start trading

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old, married, and has a young son who is one-and-a-half years old. She lives in Accra, Ghana, with her family. Her husband sells second-hand clothing, and she sells eggs.

Lydia has a secondary education and is a very responsible and enterprising woman. She plans to purchase a large quantity of eggs from the central market, and thus she requires a loan.

Lydia's Group has been together for three years. They sell eggs, provisions, and medicine. The group needs a total of GHS 1,850 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is 60 years old. He lives in the small village of Senaki District with his wife. Givi has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, two calves and three pigs. Besides these animals, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Givi has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Givi will begin trading piglets. He plans to purchase piglets and after few months re-sell them at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading piglets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is thirty six years old, married to Paul, and a mother of two. She sells jewelery in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years, earning a monthly income of 24,000 shillings.

This will be Cecilia's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy earrings, chains, and rings in bulk for resale. 

In future she wants to educate her children and also start farming.

loans.use: to purchase new earrings, chains, rings, etc., for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and six grandchildren. He wants to buy cattle for trade. He has been in the cattle trade for 23 years. He also has a banana and coffee plantation, which helps him to earn additional income. 

His wish is to have many cattle, but he is challenged by a lack of capital. He is a hardworking man, and if he continues getting support, he will be able to fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cattle for trade.

loans.name: Adah

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married mother of two, Adah has operated a profitable salon business in Nairobi for the past six years. She is now requesting her third loan to buy hair dryers to better serve her customers.

Adah will use the extra profits generated to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her business and eventually open another salon.

loans.use: to buy dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 36 years old and a retail shop owner in Maweni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three, whose spouse provides additional income for the family. She has been in this business for the last six years and has done well.

This marks her second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase her retail stock of washing powder, toothpaste, milk, sugar, wheat and maize flour. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase her retail stock of washing powder, toothpaste, milk, sugar, wheat and maize flour

loans.name: Elbis

texts.en:
This loan will help Elbis purchase car insurance for his taxi.

Elbis moved to New York City from the Dominican Republic ten years ago. Upon arriving in the U.S., Elbis needed a job quickly but didn’t know any English. He began working as a taxi driver, earning enough to support his new life, while giving him the time to study a second language. He learned the streets of NYC quickly and found he greatly enjoyed his job. Years later, Elbis continues to drive throughout NYC, working for a taxi dispatch company. He recently saved enough money to purchase his own vehicle; however, he now needs a loan to buy car insurance.

He hopes one day to purchase several vehicles and hire employees in order to begin his own taxi company.

loans.use: to purchase auto insurance for his taxi.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her husband and daughter (in the photo). Her daughter is 19 years old and studies at European Educational Regional Academy. Marine, together with her husband, works hard to gather enough income to cover the family's costs and sustaining their lifestyle. Unfortunately, the income they gather is hardly enough for the family's living and it is very difficult for Marine to save money for her daughter's education. Marine has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. The loan is very important for Marine and her daughter to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Yerevan. She lives with her mother, brother and sister and studies at Yerevan State University. Mariam's brother is a policeman and works hard to sustain the family's living. As he is the only breadwinner in the family, the profit he earns from his work is barely enough to make ends meet, so it is very difficult for the family to save money for Mariam's education.
Mariam has applied for this loan to get the necessary funds to pay for her tuition fees for the second semester.
The loan is very important for Mariam to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives in Gyumri city, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia, which was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. People of Gyumri have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive. 

Lena studies at Public Administration Academy of the Republic of Armenia, and together with her studies she works at a local company. 

As Lena helps her family to cover daily costs, it is very difficult for her to save money for her education.

With a good credit history behind her (as she applied to SEF International for the tuition fee of the first semester last year), now Lena has requested this loan to pay for her university tuition of the second semester.

The loan is important for Lena to be able to complete her education and get a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of the second semester.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
This loan will help William purchase new materials to recover his business after losses from Hurricane Sandy. 

William has been providing custom framing and design to his local community in New York City for the past 33 years. His clients include artists, museums, galleries, designers, private collectors, photographers, corporations, and art collectors. Working out of his shop in Brooklyn, William hires three artists and one employee to carry out all deliveries, and he contracts a large amount of work to local small businesses. 

William’s business was thriving. And then Hurricane Sandy struck the East Coast. William’s shop in Brooklyn was flooded and the building, after losing power, was shut down for three weeks. Unable to work, William lost a month’s worth of income and returned to his shop to damaged materials. 

This loan will help William purchase new materials—lumber, glass, and plastics, to manufacture his frames and once again get his business back on track.

Read more about William’s business at his website: http://framesnewyork.com/

loans.use: to purchase materials to replace those damaged by Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 33 años de edad,  esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa bárbara. Hace 5 años estableció su propia pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. Ella atiende muy bien el negocio lo que le permite mantener la clientela. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras para comprar productos como azúcar, frijoles, maíz y golosinas para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su sueño es ser una gran empresaria dueña de una abarrotería y que sus hijos tengan su propio patrimonio.
texts.en: Blanca is 33 years old, married, has two children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Five years ago she established her own small grocery store where she sells basic household staples.  She attends to her business very well which allows her to maintain her clientele.  She is requesting a loan of 25,000 lempiras (HNL) to buy products like sugar, beans, corn and snacks in order to offer a variety to her customers.  Her dream is to be a great entrepreneur and owner of a grocery store and that her children have their own inheritance.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, beans, corn and snacks to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica's group consists of four women, ranging in age from 28 to 42 years old.  Veronica is 35 years old. She lives alone in Dansoman District. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success due to her low income and poor living conditions. Her only source of the income comes from selling clothing, material, and thread. 

Veronica is requesting a loan from ID-Ghana for 500 GHS, which she will use to strengthen her business. ID-Ghana provides loans and training to customers. With her loan, Veronica will able to serve a customer who had placed an order for sewing accessories. She will purchase at the wholesale price and resell with a price markup to the customer, which will bring Veronica a good income. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the same field in order to continue her business. Another part will be used for her house renovation so she can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sewing accessories to supply to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Arabela cosmetics that her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera junto a cuatro de sus hijos. Ella se ha dedicado al cultivo de café y hace dos años decidió establecer una pulpería para obtener más ingresos. En la pulpería vende sal, pan, azúcar, verduras, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar productos que no tiene actualmente como granos básicos, churros, refrescos, verduras y otros. Su meta es incrementar las ganancias y su negocio.
texts.en: María is 35 years old and a widow with 5 children.  She lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera together with four of her children.  She has worked in coffee cultivation and two years ago she decided to establish a grocery store to obtain more income.  In the grocery store she sells salt, bread, sugar, vegetables, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, etc.  She has decided to request a loan for 12,000 lempiras (HNL) to buy products that she doesn’t currently have like basic grains, churros (fried pastries), soft drinks, vegetables and other things.  Her goal is to increase her earnings and her business.

loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, churros (fried pastries), soft drinks, vegetables and other things to stock her store.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
This loan will help Nicholas purchase chiropractic equipment for his wellness and health center.

Nicholas began scheming about owning his own wellness center when he was in high school. After acquiring his doctorate degree from Life Chiropractic College West and his bachelor’s degree in fitness management, Nicholas decided to launch his own practice. 

In 2012, he began Integrative Wellness Group in Belmar, NJ. Nicholas’ one employee is his fiancée, who also earned her doctorate degree from the same college. Together they offer a range of services, including chiropractic treatment, extremity adjusting, neuromuscular re-education, kinesiotaping, exercise/rehab exercises, nutritional supplements, educational materials, rehab equipment, rib belts, and educational books. 

Visit Integrative Wellness Group’s website at: http://www.integrativewellnessgroup.com

Nicholas is currently leasing his equipment. Looking to expand the business and eliminate these rental costs, Nicholas needs a loan to purchase his own chiropractic adjusting tables and tools.

loans.use: to purchase chiropractic equipment and two adjusting tables.

loans.name: Alp

texts.en:
This loan will allow Alp to buy more inventory in order to expand his business. 

Alp moved to Miami from Turkey over 10 years ago. Just two years later, he began his own business. Tiles and Pavers of Verona imports high-quality tiles and stones carved from quarries in Turkey. Alp now owns his own quarry and factory overseas and is able to carve and import stones exactly to a customer’s order. He offers tiles from a variety of stones, including New Calacatta, Golden Gray, Arabescato, and Classic Carrara.

Now with three full-time employees, Alp is looking to expand his business. Tiles and Pavers of Verona is growing rapidly, and the demand for his tiles and flooring material is high. Alp needs a loan to purchase additional inventory in order to continue providing high quality stone to his customers.

View Alp’s website: http://tilesandpavers.com/

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to advertise her business.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
This loan will help Glenn purchase additional computer monitors to help grow his digital advertisement business.

Despite an unsteady childhood, Glenn grew up with a deep interest in both entrepreneurship and technology. By age 17, he began a small business where he trained others in his community to use computers and designed websites for businesses. After graduating from the University of Georgia with a major in political science, Glenn worked as a project manager for an analytic solutions company for several years. During this time he began crafting the idea for his own business.

In 2012, Glenn began JLAX—Go Local Display, a digital ad network business. Using his savings, Glenn purchased several 23-inch flat screen monitors and small computers to initially launch his business idea. Glenn installs screens in local businesses and throughout town and then rents out advertisement time to companies. Businesses pay Glenn according to the number of advertisements he runs for them each day. Glenn’s business is already proving to be successful and he now has monitors installed in 23 locations throughout Coffee County, GA and over 50 accounts with local businesses.

Now looking to expand his business and attract more clients, Glenn needs a loan to purchase more equipment for future locations. Glenn hopes to soon install screens in 26 new locations among three nearby cities.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment for his advertising company.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Yerevan town with her mother and studies at Yerevan State University. She is in the fourth course. 

Lusine works at a local company and her salary allows her to cover her household costs, but is not enough to save for education. 

Lusine is requesting a loan for 150,000 AMD, which she will use to pay for university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Yerevan town. He lives with his parents and studies at Yerevan State Engineering University. Hovhannes works at a local company and is the only breadwinner in the family. The income he gets from his work is barely enough to make ends meet. 

Hovhannes works hard to sustain his family and it is very difficult for him to save money for his education. He has requested a loan from SEF International to pay for university tuition.

The loan is very important for Hovhannes to complete his education, become a good specialist and find a better job.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Santos Melbin

texts.es: Santos, tiene 33 años de edad,  vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, reside en el municipio de azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Santos siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace tres años inicio con la compra y venta de chatarra y artículos plásticos para reciclar. Estos artículos los vende a una fábrica de reciclaje. Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar chatarra en otros lugares para venderlos a la fábrica. Su sueño es superarse económicamente
texts.en:
Santos, 33, lives in a common-law marriage with his partner, with whom he has two children.  He lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

Santos has always made a living in trade.  Three years ago he started buying and selling scrap metal and plastic items to recycle.  He sells these articles to a recycling factory.

Currently he's requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy scrap metal in other places to sell to the factory.

His dream is to improve himself economically.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Kifiloe

texts.en:
Kifiloe is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Kifiloe is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“Am studying Bachelor Degree in Business Administration and I enjoy the subject that includes business in it. Be it Management, Business Principles and also Physiology of Consciousness.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“After graduating, I am hoping to work for a big company such as Anglo American, FNB and BHP as a general manager or human resources, but only for limited years and after 10 years I would have gathered enough money and knowledge, skills to open to my own marketing company. I would love to remain in the city of Gold, Johannesburg, and travel the world for fun and knowledge.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in 1991 both in Meadowlands, Soweto. My mother had just broken up with my father because he says am not his child. I come from a family of four children, three boys and one girl which is me. My mother is a single mother who raised her children alone without any help. My mother is a domestic worker and raising us was very difficult, to see us going to school and at the same time provide food and clothes for us.”

What do you do in your spare time?
"In my spare time I like listening to music to ease my mind and watch movies. I love reading novels and taking walks in the afternoon for exercise.”

How will the Kiva Loan change your life?
“Kiva Loan will change my life very much. It will also have a positive effect to my family knowing that someone is helping me fund my studies and also I will have that burden off loaded on my shoulders. It will give me a clearer vision to work hard towards my studies knowing that someone out there believes in me and helping me reach my full potential of knowledge.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis moved from Uruguay to New York City ten years ago with the vision of owning his own business. After years of working in the delivery service, Luis finally launched his own company San Nacional Freight, Inc. over a year ago. Subcontracted by FedEx, Luis transports goods throughout the New England region. Many of his larger contracts are with companies in the medical field and he often carries medicines and products that need to be refrigerated during the long commute. Luis needs a loan to repair the refrigerator box in his truck in order to continue to supply services to these companies. 

He hopes to one day purchase more trucks and hire employees to expand his freight delivery business.

loans.use: to repair the refrigerator box for his truck.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 31 years old and lives in Accra, the capital of Ghana, with her husband and two children. She has requested a loan of 1,400 GHS (Ghana cedis) to allow her buy enough milk, soap and eggs to sell to customers. 

She started this business in 2011 and has been working very hard to grow the business. Her husband is a taxi driver who supplements her financially, but she has to work to support the children's education.

The 1,400 GHS will give her five crates of eggs, two boxes of milk and two boxes of soap, and she will be buying the items from the wholesale market to retail to customers.

loans.use: To buy enough milk, soap and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and an entrepreneur with great projects in her future. Her biggest dream is to have her manufactured cream sold nationwide, which is why she wants a loan of 1,200 GHS (Ghana cedis), so that she can buy enough materials to manufacture body cream and make enough profits to change the economic situation of her family. She dreams of being a great businesswoman and the best in the country. 

She is married and has one child.

loans.use: To buy ingredients which she will use to manufacture body creams to supply to customers.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leslie works hard to support her family.

She has a food-production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Leslie is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Leslie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an orthopedic bed.

loans.name: Vallerian

texts.en:
Having gone through the challenges of unemployment and several job losses, Vallerian, a teacher by profession in his late 30s, teamed up with other colleagues to start a primary school, Honest Model Primary School, in Rwenge, a surburb in Ibanda district. 

They started the school in makeshift structures with little capital to meet staff salaries and school requirements. Vallerian says he faced several challenges in the beginning including threats from local administration to close the school because of non-compliance with the required school standards.

However, due to his hard work and determination, they managed to change the status of the school and now it is in a commendable status, fully registered with government. It also has permanent structures. 

On behalf of the school directors, Vallerian has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy windows and door shutters for the semi-completed school building. He hopes that with the school structures looking complete, they will get more pupils enrolling.

In the photograph is Vallerian and his wife. She is also one of the directors of the school.

loans.use: To buy windows and doors for his new school.

loans.name: Floyd

texts.en:
For decades, Floyd cooked alongside his mother, who loved to cook and bake, and accepted catering jobs from church friends and co-workers.  Floyd's mother has passed away, but he still has fond memories of helping his mom feed their friends. “I love people and I love food,” Floyd said. 

Because he enjoyed feeding people, Floyd decided to open Soul 2 Soul Cafe in Birmingham, Alabama in 2010, offering barbecue and soul food menu items. Floyd has big dreams for his business.

“Within the next year or so, we would like to expand and do catering, as well as initiate breakfast offerings,” Floyd said. “I think adding breakfast will greatly increase traffic flow, as well as increase our good word of mouth.”

To expand his restaurant’s offerings, Floyd said he plans to buy another stove and a luncheon meat slicer. To fund these plans, he applied for an Accion Texas in Louisiana loan.  Floyd learned about Accion from a City of Birmingham Economic Development Department and Community partner.

“It has been a wonderful experience with Accion,” Floyd said. “And it has been a dream come true. I would like to say to whoever has a dream, to pursue that dream with all due diligence and to wait for the benefits to come in. Because that doesn't happen the first time you try to pursue your dreams, and it doesn't come easily. But if you love it, pursue your dream.”

loans.use: to buy another stove and a luncheon meat slicer.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is 30 years old and married with one kid.

Norlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, bread, soft drinks, frozen foods and other groceries.

Norlyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Norlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, bread, soft drinks, frozen foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Maha Shakti Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four women from Ranipur village of Khariar block of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, formed a group named Maha Shakti to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business.  Belmati is one of them, the lady sitting second from right in the photo, raising her hand. Belmati is a poor lady who lives with her husband, one son, and two daughters. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. The Government have provided a house to her under Indira Awash Yojana (Housing Scheme).

 Belmati has been running a spice items vending business with items like chilly, cumin seeds, coriander, turmeric, garlic, etc. for the last 10 years. Her husband goes to six weekly markets of her locality every week with bulk of items on a moped and sells in the market.  Her monthly income from the existing business is Rs.3000. Out of this income she can hardly manage her household expenses. She wants to increase the stock of her business, so the loan amount will be utilized to purchase items like chilly, coriander, cumin seed, etc.in bulk to keep the business stocked for a month. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently from the nearest market and she can add a substantial income to her present income.

 Belmati hopes to purchase a bike to run her business smoothly with sufficient items and to build a house. The other three members of the group are Deimati, Bela and Rekha who are running a general grocery shop and vegetable vending businesses.

loans.use: To pay for  purchasing  chilly, coriander, cumin seed, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a building and expand his organization.

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Owning a business has always been Darius’s dream. He and his wife opened Encore Consignment Boutique a year ago and he says the business has taken off. Encore Consignments specializes in fashionable plus-size clothing, as well as shoes, accessories and hand-crafted locally-made jewelry and other items.  

Darius’s fashion-savvy wife manages the daily operation of the boutique, along with caring for their four children.  Currently, Darius’s wife is the sole full-time employee, but his vision to expand the business is not too far in the future.  He plans to hire staff once he can afford to pay them.  

With help from Accion Texas Inc., Darius was able to pay for print advertising and purchase women’s apparel such as dresses, shoes, purses and other accessories.  Part of the loan will go towards operating costs of the facility on a daily basis.  Without this loan, Darius said he would not have been able to acquire this new merchandise or advertising to grow his business.  

The local Chamber of Commerce in Alabama referred Darius to Accion Alabama – an extension of Accion.  

With Accion’s help, Darius said his dream has come true.

loans.use: to pay for print advertising and purchase women’s apparel such as dresses, shoes, purses and other accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase modern and more efficient lawn mowers, fuel for his machines, and to create cash flow for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Duhindurimikorere Group

texts.fr:
GODEFROID est membre du groupe DUHINDURIMIKORERE, il est agé de 36 ans , il est marie et a 6 enfants dont le plus grand a 8 ans et le plus petit a 3 an. 2 vont à l`école.il a étudie l`école primaire.

Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.
Il n`attend aucune difficulté pour le remboursement.
Le stratégies pour la croissance de sona ctivité est de lutter contre l`érosion.
Ses ambitions est de dévenir l`agriculteur moderne et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
GODEFROID is a member of the DUHINDURIMIKORERE group. He is 36 years old. He is married and has six children, the eldest of whom is eight years old and the youngest of whom is three years old. Two of his children go to school. GODEFROID has a primary school education.

He is seeking a loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the workers. He does not expect to have any difficulty in paying back the loan. His strategy for growing his business is to try to limit erosion.

His goal is to become a modern farmer, and he would like for his children to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay workers

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés 59 años de edad con siete hijos, es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la compra de cerdo y destace de cerdo entre dos y tres cerdos semanal, las compras las realiza al contado en comarcas vecinas y/o productores de cerdos de granja, las ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos, eventuales y nuevos venta que realiza de forma ambulante(Chancho con Yuca, vigoron, pepenas, fritos, moronga, chorizos,  ) en mercados negocio que tiene más de 19 años, el cual es un medio de vida, inicia este negocio desde muy joven como una alternativa de trabajo para ayudar en los gastos de su casa. María Inés siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a su negocio a pesar der su salud ella no se deja vencer y sale en busca de  los cerdos los cuales escoge y pagar por el transporte para trasladarlo hasta su vivienda. Su sueño siempre ha sido mantener su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
María Inés is 59 years old and has seven children.  She is a small business owner who works purchasing and butchering pigs.  She buys two or three pigs a week on credit from neighboring districts and/or pig farm producers.  She accepts cash or provides credit to her regular customers.  She makes new sales by traveling (pork with yucca, cabbage salad, meat, fried items, sausage, and chorizo) in markets.  She has had her business for more than 19 years and it makes a living.  She started this business when she was very young as a way to help with the household expenses.  

María Inés has always been a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business in spite of her health.  She does not give up and goes in search of pigs, which she choses and pays for transporting them to her home.  

Her dream has always been to maintan her business and be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, oil, salt, yucca, and condiments.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is 32 years old, married and has one child. She grows corn and hires additional laborers to help her in the cornfield. Lanie would like to make her crops productive but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000.
