She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming. She hopes to keep improving crop production and someday harvest it abundantly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco 51 años casado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, lugar turístico José es propietario de dos negocios como es la Ebanistería y una Disco Móvil, con esta presta los servicios al público en general para eventos sociales como: Cumpleaños, Casamientos, Quinceaños y fiestas particulares de cualquier tipo, en la ebanistería elabora diferentes tipos de muebles como: camas, cunas, roperos, puertas entre otros, José Francisco desde muy joven empezó con este negocio para llevar el sustento a su casa y que no les faltaran a sus dos hijos y asi brindarles un mejor futuro para ellos, uno de sus sueños es verlos a ellos terminar sus estudios siendo profesionales y así sentirse realizado, él está muy agradecido con la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas les brindan a personas de bajos recursos ya que gracias a ellos él ha ido mejorando su nivel de Vida y incrementando sus negocios. Él está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en su disco móvil en la compra de dos cajas de poder, alambres, entre otros accesorios más.-
texts.en:
José Francisco is 51 years old, married, and has two young children.  He is originally from Chinandega, an area known for commerce and as a tourist destination.  José owns two businesses since he is a workworker and a disc jockey.  As a DJ, he provides services to the public for social events such as birthdays, weddings, 15th birthday parties, and private parties of any kind.  As a woodworker, he makes different types of furniture such as beds, cots, wardrobes, doors, and other items.  

José Francisco started this business when he was very young in order to suport his household so that his two children do not lack for anything and he can provide them with a better future.  One of his dreams is to see them finish their studies and become professionals, which will make him feel accomplished.  

He is very grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources since thanks to them, he has been improving his quality of life and expanding his businesses.  He is requesting a loan to invest in his disc jockey business by purchasing two power boxes, power cables, and other accessories.

loans.use: to purchase two power boxes and other accessories.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is married and his family lives peacefully in Enrile. He and his wife, a vegetable vendor, have three children. Rodolfo is a farmer who raises corn to sell. He is very patient in maintaining good harvests in his farming business. Rodolfo hopes to make crops more productive. That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in farming. It will help provide good nutrition for his crops and increase yields someday.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 44 years old, married and has four children. He and his spouse grow corn to sell. He had been in his business over five years and earns about PHP 20,000 each harvest season (twice a year). He is able to pay school fees, daily meals, bills at home and has revolving capital in the business. He hopes to improve crop growth but has insufficient funds. That is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming. 

With continuous efforts and patience in developing the farming business, Robert will someday gain the fruits of his hard work and will lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 41 years old and married with four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a banana plantation in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010. She is now  requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Rocely

texts.en: Rocely is married, with two children. She is engaged in making fish paste as a source of income. She wants to expand her business and overcome their poor living. For this reason, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy small fishes and salt to make a fish paste. She hopes this loan amount will be a big help to provide her with her desired income.

loans.use: to buy small fishes and salt to make a fish paste.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús de 51 años de edad Soltero padre de tres hijos, que están bajo su cargo, es propietario de un negocio de  venta de mercadería en general,  como Ropa, calzados, cosméticos entre otros, negocio que tiene desde hace más de 14 años, el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante, sus ventas son al credito y al contado los cuales recupera semanl y quincenal, por lo que no mantiene productos en su hogar. el Desde muy temprano se levanta todos los dias con su bolso que pesa entre 30 y 50 kilogramos ofreciendo su mercadería, actividad que desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es el sustento para sus hijos, Manuel siempre se ha desempeñado por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, honesto,  siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante.  Uno de sus sueños  es poder realizar mejoras a la vivienda que adquirió, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería en general, para asi obtener mejores ingresos. Manuel está muy agradecido con la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos  para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel De Jesús, age 51, is the single father of three children who are under his care.  He has a business selling general merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics, among others.  He has had the business for over 14 years.  

He sells in an itinerant manner.  His sales are for credit and for cash, and he collects weekly and biweekly.  He does not maintain the products in his house.

He gets up very early every day.  With his bag that weighs between 30 and 50 kilograms, he offers his merchandise.  He does this business activity with much pleasure because it supports his children.  

Manuel has always conducted himself as a hard-working, responsible, and honest man.  He is always looking for the way to get ahead.  One of his dreams is to be able to make improvements to the house that he got.

The objective of this loan is to invest working capital to stock his business.  He will buy general merchandise in order to get better income.  Manuel is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce financial resources so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, among other products.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 66 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Leonora owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her business, such as manure.

loans.name: Lourdevica

texts.en:
Lourdevica is 55 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lourdevica has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Lourdevica requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to souse and dry for sale.

Lourdevica has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lourdevica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to souse and dry for sale.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 36, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a driver and a father to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalie operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, like bananas and mangoes, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. Her regular customers are the local tourists in their community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosalie is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. 

Rosalie hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have a strong body to do all her responsibilities. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en:
Maresa is 33 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Maresa owns and operates a home products business, such as selling metal roofs. She has been in her business for over five years and earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for rent. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for rent.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 21years old and earns a living by direct selling of MSE and Avon products. She has been in this line of work for half a year and has been pursuing this while sending herself to school. She also thanks her parents for their support in her business. 

Now, to improve her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy Avon products such as face powder, lipstick and lotion that have been requested by her customers. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her sales and provide her greater funding for her schooling.

loans.use: to buy Avon products such as face powder, lipstick and lotion

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed products for her business. The loan also helped in her household expenses as well as in the education of her children. She has had this business for eight years and she continues to work for her family. Her husband is very supportive of her. He works as a mason.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Zenaida hopes for a continues growth in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for stock of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Alejandra Candelaria

texts.es: Alejandra Candelaria, 51 años de edad casada con seis hijos, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del pais, zona donde predomina el ron y la azucar,diferentes comercios, Alejandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante, es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a varios negocios como venta de cosmeticos, mercaderia en general,asi tambien como compra y venta de cerdos y crianza de pollo, el cual desde muy joven se ha dedicado a este negocio y con el tiempo ha ido invirtiendo en los otros, brindandole un mejor ingreso , sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos los cuales ofrece al contado y al credito a clientes fijos y eventuales, negocio  que lo realiza ambulante y en su casa de habitacion,uno de sus sueños es de terminar de mejorar su vivienda para asi tener un lugar  digno de vivir y tener mejores condiciones para uno de sus negocios(crianza de pollos), ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cerdos en pie, concentrado para sus pollos, cosmeticos, rooa, entre otros productos mas.
texts.en:
Alejandra Candelaria is 51 years of age and married with six children. She is a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega, a region located in the western portion of the country that is predominantly involved in the rum and sugar industries as well as other commercial activities. 

Alejandra is a hard-working woman who has managed to come out ahead. She is a small-business woman involved in several businesses such as the sale of cosmetics and the sale of merchandise in general. She also buys and sells pigs and raises chickens - a business that she has been running since her youth. Over time she began investing in the other businesses which have increased her income. She makes her purchases in wholesale markets which offer regular and possible clients cash and credit. She conducts her business selling in the street and from her home.  

One of her dreams is to finish her home renovations and thus have a more dignified dwelling with better conditions for one of her businesses (raising chickens). She is requesting a loan to buy swine, chicken feed, clothes, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chicken feed and cosmetics among other items.

loans.name: Lebrito

texts.en:
Lebrito is a farmer who lives in Enrile, in the Philippines with his wife and children. They have eight children. His wife is a vegetable vendor. Lebrito goes to the rice fields daily to visit and monitor his rice crops. He had been planting and harvesting rice to sell for over 20 years and earns about P20,000 each harvest season twice a year. He hopes to keep nourishing his crops with fertilizer and insecticide. 

Lebrito is asking for a loan of P30,000 to pay labor fees, buy fertilizer and insecticide for use in farming. It will help maintain good nutrition for his crops. Someday, it will lead to a productive harvest to increase income for his family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to pay labor fees, buy fertilizer and insecticide for use in farming

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 53 years old/ She is married and has children to sustain. She is married to a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. She also helps her husband in maintaining a good farming business. Encarnacion has insufficient funds to sustain her crops. She is asking for a loan P35,000 to buy pesticide and insecticide for use in farming. This will help ensure good nutrition to her rice crops. She promises to pay back her loan in full. 

Continuous patience and hard work will lead to a successful farming business.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and insecticide for use in farming

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is a farmer and lives peacefully in Enrile in the Philippines with his child. His wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker. They work hard to sustain the needs of their family. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders and usually earns P20,000 each harvest season twice a year. He hopes to improve crop production but has insufficient funds. He is asking for a loan to provide enough nutrition to his crops. He is asking for P30,000 to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees for transplanting rice seedlings.

He hopes to keep providing good nutrition to his crops and eventually have a productive harvest. Additional revenue will be saved for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees for transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Techi Rosa

texts.es:
Techi es una mujer de 29 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar ayudar a su familia, Techi no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Techi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de tubérculos, como papa, camote y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Techi se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera Techi tendrá un lugar adecuado para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Techi, a 29 year old woman, is single and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who wants to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work to help her family, Techi couldn't go to school for Nursing, but she dreams of doing so. In her free time, she likes to play sports and, sometimes, she cooks the delicious Ají de Gallina (a chicken stew with peppers) for herself and her family.

All on her own, and with much determination, Techi works in a small business selling tubers such as potatoes, sweet potatoes, and other items. She works every day for around 10 hours. She believes her business is going well due to the fair prices and her customer services skills. 

Techi is very grateful for the Kiva loans. From this help, she will be able to buy a food stall in her city's central market, which will give Techi a good place to continue serving her customers. It will also help her to keep working and striving to realize her dream of having a great restaurant and her own home.

loans.use: to buy a food stall

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 43. She is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth bottle of cooking oil, or an egg. She gets supplies at wholesale prices and then sells each piece individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She requests a 10,000 PHP loan to help to her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lourdes dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups which meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a farmer who lives in Enrile with his wife and children. Efren raises crops. He primarily plants and harvests rice to sell. While he is busy in the rice field, Efren's wife, Elena, raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. She sells them to butchers. The couple earns about 10,000 PHP monthly in their businesses. 

Efren wants to guarantee the health of his crops, but he currently has insufficient funds. That is why he is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy pesticides and fertilizers to use in his farming work. 

Someday, Efren and his family will achieve a better life if they continue to develop their businesses and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 47 лет, имеет 3 детей. Бактыгул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав с суммы (KGS) 10,000 сом в 1996 году. Благодаря упорному труду,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3, га земли с посевом зерновых культур, 4 головы крупного рогатого скота и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul is 47 years old and has three children. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows produce. She launched this business in 1996 with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes three ha [about 7.5 acres] of land for growing grains, four heads of cattle and one horse. In order to develop her business further, Baktygul applied to the microfinance institution “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS intended for buying livestock for fattening. Baktygul plans to use the revenues from her loan in a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nizom

texts.ru: Низом предыдущий кредит брал для приобретения косметики и аксессуаров. Он успешно продолжает свою торговую деятельность. У него 10-летний опыт в этом бизнесе. Низом очень хороший торговец. Он обращается со своими клиентами учтиво и доброжелательно. Сейчас Низом хочет увеличить товарооборот. Он запрашивает повторный кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (косметики и детских игрушек).
texts.en:
Nizom took out a previous loan in order to purchase cosmetics and various accessories. He continues to run his business with success because he's a very good salesman with 10 years of experience. Nizom is very polite and kind to his customers. 

Nizom wants to increase his goods turnover. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some more cosmetics and toys for children.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and children's toys.

loans.name: Ma. Kristina

texts.en: Kristina is a single mother who manages a direct selling business of Avon, MSE, and Natasha products. She is doing her best to make a good income for her child. Kristina  wants to maximize her offered products and is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy lotion, whitening soap, and facial wash.  She hopes that through her loan, she will gain a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, whitening soap, and facial wash.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.ru:
Лусине родилась 1976г. в городе Капан. После окончания школы она поступила в Ереванский лингвистический  университет ,по специальности учительница английского языка и литературы. 
Лусине замужем, муж работает на телевидении г.Капан.  Лусине  более 7 лет работает в школе и преподает английский язык и литературу. Кроме школы у Лусине есть 9 учеников старших классов с которыми она платно  занимается английским языком и готовит их к вступительным экзаменам на Высшие Учебные Заведения у себя дома. 
Лусине очень любит свою профессию, с любовью и с терпением всегда относится ко всем своим ученикам и абитуриентам. 
Лусине нуждается в кредите на сумму 900.000 Армянских драм для покупки нового персонального компьютера, принтера и школьных пренодлежностей. Новый компьютер поможет лусине организовать дома свои курсы английского более эффективно и с помощью интернета она сможет ознакомится с новейшими преподавательскими методами английского языка  в Мире.
texts.en:
Lusine was born in 1976 in Kapan, Armenia. After finishing school, she was accepted at the Yerevan State Linguistic University from which she graduated as an English teacher. Lusine's husband works for a TV station. 
For more than 7 years she's worked as a schoolteacher. Additionally, she tutors 9 students at her home preparing them for university entrance examinations.

Lusine loves her job and is always very kind and patient to her students. She's asking for loan of 900,000 drams in order to purchase to a new computer, printer and other school supplies. This new computer will allow her organize her lesson plans more effectively while an internet connection will give her access to new methods used to teach english around the world.

loans.use: To buy a new computer, printer, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Rosamilda

texts.es: La Sra. Rosamilda tiene 29 años y tiene  dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene su tienda  que se encuentra en la zona de Bibosi de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rosamilda va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de galletas, empanadas y tortas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Rosamilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que existe en la zona como también la  de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Rosamilda is 29 years old and has two children. She makes a living from baking and selling a variety of pastries in her bakery located in the Bibosi zone of the city of Santa Cruz. 

This is her first loan sequence with the institution. Rosamilda will use the loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar and yeast to make cookies, pies and cakes. She is requesting the loan as she lacks the capital to finance her business. In her business, Rosamilda faces challenges such as the competition in the area and improving her quality of life and she will use the profits she makes to increase her production. She is very happy for the opportunity she is being offered through the loan as this is the only activity she can do that allows her to provide for herself.

loans.use: buy supplies such as flour, yeast and butter

loans.name: Lizeth Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de la Costanera,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Claudia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda más grande y surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia, 24, makes a living selling basic necessities in her neighborhood store in the Costanera area.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She's going to use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her business: groceries, sweets, and soft drinks.  She's requesting the loan because she has a lot of demand; this is how she increases her sales and she needs to stock her merchandise.  She's going to use the profits to buy more merchandise to stock her store and continue growing more every day.

The challenge Claudia faces in her business is competition because there are several stores in the area.  Her desire for her business is to keep on selling and to have a bigger and better-stocked store so she can make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 32 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Aireen has a general store business in the Philippines. Aireen requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her 'sari-sari' store.

Aireen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aireen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her 'sari-sari' store.

loans.name: Frederico

texts.en:
As a young couple, Federico and his wife knew they wanted to someday own their own business.  With a strong background in architectural design, Federico had the expertise to visualize quality designs and furniture.  Federico’s creations combined with his wife, Haydee’s, decorative taste and eye for design helped them create a successful custom event design and planning business, Concepts Event Design.

Federico and Haydee have now been in the design business for over 12 years and have created a company that designs and crafts unique, quality weddings and events.  What sets Concepts Event Design apart is Federico’s commitment to providing designs and furniture as special and unique as the wedding couple.  Federico’s custom-made furniture pieces and his wife’s custom-designed linens provide an atmosphere totally unique to each couple.

Federico trains his staff of 12+ in the importance of crafting an event that will be special and memorable.  He shared his personal work philosophy, “When you do something—even placing table settings—do it as if it were your own event.  Our business card is the environment we create and the presentation of our designs.”  

For Federico, the best part of owning his own business is seeing the end results and watching the bride and groom’s faces light up with awe.  “Many people dream of their wedding for years.  We love what we do because we know that we were able to deliver what we were hired to do—making dream weddings come true.”

A loan of $8,000 through Kiva will enable Federico to purchase loading racks to protect and transfer his quality and unique furniture, linens, and other event storage equipment safely through his large warehouse.  With your help, Federico and Haydee can continue to expand their business to provide special events and memories for couples.

For more information about Concepts Event Design, Inc, visit http://www.conceptseventdesign.com

loans.use: to purchase loading racks to protect and transfer his quality and unique furniture, linens, and other event storage equipment

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en: Josephina is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Calamaba, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last five years by running a grocery store. She earns 7,000 PHP every month and joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell, including coffee, sugar, canned goods and bond paper. Her goal for the future is to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia Maritza tiene 35 años tiene 2 hijos y es soltera,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de pollipapas que es un plato a base de pollo con papas,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 6 años,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las pollipapas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollo y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maritza, 35, is single and has two children.

She makes a living selling "pollipapas," a dish made of chicken with potatoes.  She works as a street vendor from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has had this business for six years.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her pollipapas.

She's requesting the loan to buy chicken and potatoes.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy chicken and potatoes

loans.name: Carlos Willy

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 51 años y tiene  2 hijos que son de las edades de  15 y 13  años, el es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de sandia y frutales en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Espejo,  este préstamo es su tercera  secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Carlos va a usar este préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus cítricos y de jamaica para la posterior cosecha, El Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar su producción,  El Sr. Carlos vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su única actividad desde hace varios años que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Carlos is 51 and has two children, ages 15 and 13. He is a framer who grows watermelon and fruits on land in Espejo. This is his third loan cycle with the institution. Carlos will use the loan to maintain citrus and Jamaica plantings. The challenge that Carlos faces is improving his living conditions, and he plans to use his profits to increase production. 

Carlos sells directly to consumers at the local market. He is happy and grateful to have this loan opportunity, since for several years this business has been his only means of support.

loans.use: to maintain citrus and Jamaica plantings.

loans.name: Cherrie My

texts.en:
Cherrie My is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

In the future, Cherry My wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 21 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana farm to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than three years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a petty trader, who primarily sells salted fish, meat and onions, in her village of Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Linda has been working as a petty trader for nearly six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, meat and onions, thus allowing her to meet rising consumer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to further diversify the kinds of food that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish, meat and onions, thus allowing her to meet rising consumer demand.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María Susana  de 55 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos de 25, 21,18 años, de los cuales solamente el de 18 estudia, y está bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con su familia, y cocinar un plato típico de la región como es “indio viejo” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo y fórmalo  profesionalmente. 

Gracia  a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos y leña de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Anteriormente se desempeña en la venta en la elaboración y venta de tortillas, por recomendación del médico tuvo que dejar de hacer las tortillas porque padece una enfermedad llamada reumatismo, a consecuencia de las elaboraciones de las tortillas porque significaba calentarse las manos y después mojarse por los quehaceres diarios.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos.  María Susana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Susana, 55, is the single mother of three children, ages 25, 21, and 18. Only the 18-year-old is still a student and dependent on her. She was born in Sauce, located in northern Nicaragua. In her free time, she likes to have fun with her family and cook a regional chicken stew. Sadly, she lacked the resources to go to college; therefore, she strives each day to offer her son a brighter future and professional training. 

She wants to succeed and has been selling cosmetics and wood both as a street vendor and from her home. Previously, she made and sold tortillas. Her doctor advised her to give up this activity because she suffers rheumatism, and making tortillas required that she heat and wet her hands. She now works eight hours each day.

She will use the loan as working capital to stock her business. María Susana thanks Kiva lenders for offering low-income people in countries like Nicaragua a chance for decent work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like blush, lipstick, eyeliner, shadow, body cream, and perfume to stock her business.

loans.name: Abdukodirjon

texts.ru:
Абдукодирчон ответственный,пунктуальный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасти 56 лет.  Он женат и имеет детей.  Жена домохозяйка.  Абдукодирчон по профессии режиссер.    Уже несколько лет работает в театре.   Ему очень нравится его работа, но заработной платы очень мало и не хватает на проживание, поэтому он дома занимается откормом скота.   Этот вид деятельности дает очень хороший доход.  Его единственный сын находится в РФ на заработках,и каждый месяц по возможности присылает денежные средства родителям.
 Абдукодирчон с 2010 года кредитуется в организации  Арванд.  За период кредитования показал себя с положительной стороны.  Он давно хотел произвести ремонт в своем доме но в связи с финансовыми проблемами ему этого не удавалось.  На данный момент у него есть немного  денег  на ремонт дома ,но так как эти средства не достаточны он хочет получить кредит купить строительные материалы  и отремонтировать свой дом.   Абдукодирчон надеется на  помощь и поддержку со стороны Арванд.
texts.en:
Abdukodirjon is a very responsible, punctual, and hardworking 56-year-old man with a wife and a son.
Abdukodirjon works as a director in a theater, but has to supplement his salary with a side business of breeding cattle which is very profitable. His son, who is away working in Russia, helps them out with money sends every month. 

Abdukodirjon has been involved with Armand since 2010, where he's viewed very positively. Due to a difficult financial situation, he hasn't been able to make some long wanted repairs around his house. He's been able to gather some money recently and is asking for a loan in order to finish buying building materials and finally repair his house. 
Abdukodirjon is hoping for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Leslie Marie

texts.en:
Leslie Marie is 20 years old and had a child. She is married to a farmer. To make a living, they plant and harvest corn to sell. She also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. 

Leslie Marie hopes to keep improving their farming business; that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help improve crop production. Additional revenue will be invested in the hog-raising business, too.

Leslie and her spouse hope to become successful corn-growers someday and maintain a simple and happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Medilene

texts.en:
Medilene is 44 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are aged between 17 years and four years old.

Medilene has a farming business that she has been doing for many years and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy seeds and fertilizers to use on her farm.

She hopes to expand her farming business in the near future and be able to diversify into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She operates a petty trading business in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Adjoa is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of petty goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of petty goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Amartungalag

texts.en:
Amartungalag is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her elder son works in Korea on an employment contract and transfers money each month to her bank account. From 1984 to 1991, she worked in the technique and equipment supply department of Darkhan, but she was unemployed when the Soviet Union collapsed and Mongolia began transforming its centralized market into a free market. After unemployed, she began to travel to China and purchased items to sell to the local people at retail price. Since 2000, she has been selling vegetables and fruits to local people at an outdoor market. Now her business is expanded and she sells wide variety of goods such as toys, souvenirs, and clothes. 

With her previous loan, she decorated her house and a installed steam heated furnace.She is requesting another loan for 5,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase hardwood floors and roofing materials. During the winter, the house loses its heat through the floor and roof. If they had hardwood floors and updated roof, the house will no longer lose its heat and the family will reduce its usage of coal and release less smoke thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase hardwood floors and roofing materials.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Even though Alex grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for him and his family. 

Currently, Alex is an entrepreneur. He sells charcoal in Ekumfi-Twa (near Cape Coast). His business has grown substantially since he started it six years ago. He uses the income from his business to support his eight children. 

Alex has identified that there is growing demand for his product. However, he is unable to meet this demand due to limited capacity. So he aims to use his loan to purchase additional firewood to make more charcoal to sell. 

With the new profits from his expanded business, Alex wants to ensure that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to make more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Budiriro Chada Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Farai from Masvingo. He is married and has four children, one of whom is attending school. He also cares for one additional dependent. Farai runs a retail business and sells groceries and agricultural inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. The business has been in operation for eight years. He says the main challenge he faces is transportation costs, which are too high. 

Farai has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to grow his business and maintain profitability. In the future, Farai plans to increase the number of his business outlets.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale, as well as beer and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 66 años de edad, vive en la maravillosa ciudad de Pucallpa, Pucallpa se caracteriza por ser una ciudad muy hermosa ya que se encuentra en la selva peruana y alberga flora y fauna bellísima, es una ciudad en la cual se puede apreciar lo maravilloso de la naturaleza y sobre todo despejarse del bullicio de la ciudad además que los pobladores son muy amables y generosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear y sobre todo ir a su iglesia; también en algunas oportunidades le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo  Ceviche. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación  primaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Lucio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de renovadora de calzado, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque siempre trabaja de buen humor y con muchas ganas.

Lucio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo, ya que en esta oportunidad podrá comprar materiales de construcción para colocar falso piso en su vivienda, ya que en esta época hay muchos turistas y poder alquilar algunos cuartos para ellos, de esta manera el mejorara su calidad de vida y podrán mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su fábrica de calzado”.
texts.en:
Lucio is 66. He lives in the marvelous city of Pucallpa. Pucallpa is known to be a very beautiful city, as it is located in the Peruvian rainforest and is home to gorgeous flora and fauna. It is a city in which one can appreciate the marvels of nature and be free of the hustle and bustle of the city. What's more, the residents are very kind and generous. 
When he has free time, Lucio enjoys going for walks and, above all, going to his church. He also enjoys eating his favourite food, the rich Ceviche. Because of economic reasons, he was only able to stay in school until grade four. He would have liked to have a university career.
Day to day, Lucio works in his small shoe repair business. He works approximately ten hours per day and can see up to 15 customers. He thinks that this business is going well for him because he always works with a good attitude and great enthusiasm.
Lucio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. This is the second time he is receiving their support. This time he will be able to buy construction materials in order to lay flooring in his home; there are a lot of tourists in this season and he will be able to rent out some rooms to them. His quality of life will improve, and he will be able to increase his income and keep working in order to achieve his greatest dream:  "Having a shoe factory".

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old and married to Peter, who contributes to the family income. They have two children, aged 13 and five years. 

She has been running her business of selling new clothes and accessories for a period of about six years with an income of approximately 30,000 KES. a month.

She is taking a third loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes for sale. She hopes to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 53 years old and married to Assanath, who contributes to the family income.They have four children, aged 19, 17, 15 and 12 years. Patrick has been buying paraffin at wholesale, and reselling it at retail price, for a period of about three years. He earns about KES. 37,800 per month from this activity.

He is taking his second loan in KADET LTD, after having successfully repaid the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy an extra quantity of paraffin for sale. 


He hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy an extra quantity of paraffin for sale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Eric is 41, married, and blessed with three children between 15 and 8 years old.He owns a motor spare parts shop and  also  grows tea and this has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES. 16,000.

He has borrowed a fourth loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to till more land and plant more tea trees. The profits he gets from his business will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is have a better living.

loans.use: to till more land and raise more tea plantations.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 42 years old and married to Ngugi. They have two children ages 13 and 15. Alice has been running the business for five years, which has been rewarding. 

She is now getting a profit of about KES.20,000 a month. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD, and it has helped her grow the business and increase profits. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more welding material and metal for sale. She hopes to have a big hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy metals and welding materials.

loans.name: Loverance

texts.en:
After graduating  junior high school, Loverance decided to set up her own grocery and cosmetics business in Mpohor (near Takoradi). 

With over four years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her purchase more groceries and cosmetics for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a welder) in the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is a small-scale food vendor in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a driver.  Pricilla has been working as a food vendor for close to three years. As the sole provider in the family since her husbands business has not been doing well for a while now, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general living expenses.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of foodstuffs and other ingredients, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a food stand, which would enable her to sell from a fixed location, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of foodstuffs and other ingredients, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una mujer de 54 años de edad luchadora emprendedora que debido a la zona donde vivió su niñez sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla con sus estudios cursando hasta el segundo grado de la primaria. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra aprendiendo a realizar actividades como: limpieza, poda, fertilización y a abonar las plantaciones de café. Ella tiene 35 años de estar casada y junto a su esposo tienen 3 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo el mayor de 18 años el cual no está estudiando, el segundo de 15 años está en segundo curso de la secundaria y el ultimo de 9 años está en cuarto grado en la primaria. En la familia se dedica a trabajar y las tierras que agradecen a DIOS por todo y a sus padres por haberlas heredado las cuales están ubicadas a una distancia de 1.5 kilómetros de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, y otros insumos que ayudaran a mantener sano y limpio de plagas y enfermedades sus cultivos de café.

Su sueño es poder ampliar sus plantaciones, sembrar una mejor variedad y aprovechar la demanda de granos básicos en la zona ya que de esa manera ella podrá generar más ingresos para los estudios de sus hijos, los gastos familiares y otros que a diario se presentan.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a 54 year-old woman, hard-working and entrepreneurial, whose parents were poor and could not support her studies past the second grade of primary school due to the area where she lived during her childhood. It was her parents who taught her to work the land, learning to do things such as: clearing the fields, pruning, and fertilization for the coffee plantations.

She is 35 years old, married, and together with her husband has 3 children who live under the same roof. The oldest, 18, is not studying, the second, 15, is the second year of secondary school, and the last, 9, is in the fourth grade of primary school. In the family, they make a living by working off the land, which they thank god for everything and their parents for inheriting them. They are located at a distance of 1.5 kilometers from their home for which they move by foot each day. 

Nowadays, she is requesting a loan to help her buy fertilizer, manure, and other supplies. These will help her keep her coffee crops healthy and clean from infestation and disease. Her dream is to be able to make her farm bigger, plant a better variety, and take advantage of the demand of staple foods in the area since, this way, she will be able to generate more income for her children's studies, family expenses, and other things which come up daily.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap and eggs for resale

loans.name: Victoria  K

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Victoria from Waterloo 2 eastern area in Freetown. She is single with two children between the ages of 3 months and 5 years. One of her children is attending school. 

Victoria runs a cookery business; she sells rice, soft drinks, and pure water. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business every day, from morning to night. She also takes care of her children and mother at home.  Victoria says that the main challenge to her business is transportation is very difficult within her operation area.

Victoria has requested a loan in order to buy cooking items like milk, rice cooking oil, soft drinks, and pure water. She wanted to go to school but did not further her education. The extra profit from this loan will allow her to find a vocational training school to improve herself. In the future, she plans to import goods from neighboring countries. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cooking items like milk, rice cooking oil, soft drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell

loans.name: Abu-Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Abu-Bakarr.  He is married with two wives, and he has six children, aged 25, 22, 20, 17, 14 and 10 years. In 2008, Abu-Bakarr established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business, because he wants to take good care of his family. His business is located in the outskirts, and his customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Abu-Bakarr requires a loan, in order to buy more crates of drinks and more provisions to resell. In the future, Abu-Bakarr plans to establish his business in different areas. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions and crates of drinks to resell

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Abdulai. He is married and has two children, aged 10 and 13. He has one additional dependents, who lives with him as a sales assistant. In 2007, Abdulai established his business selling slippers, underwear, Pampers, etc. He began his business because he was trained up as a businessman. His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are men and women. Working seven days a week, 10 hours  a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Abdulai requires a loan in order to increase his stock for resale. In the future, he plans to get a bakery as a source of more income. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a joyful mother. She is 55 years old, and lives simply in Enrile with her spouse and children. 

To make a living, the couple plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. This way, they generate about PHP 10,000 each harvest season, just enough for meals and bills at home. 

She hopes to increase their income, which is why she needs a loan for farm input for crop sustenance.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) necessary to sustain her crops. 

She promises to pay back her loan in full, and keep improving crop production for the welfare of her family. She aims to become a succesful rice grower in their village.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) to use in farming.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old, married with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Teresita owns and operates a beauty salon in the local community. She has been in her business for over six years, and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase an additional beauty salon. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house, and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional beauty salon.

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en:
Pritse is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. Pritse works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a loan for PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pritse has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Pritse would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell and also purchase some few parts to replace the faulty parts of his car

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 23 years old, married to a builder and blessed with 1 child, age 1 year. She started her business because she has no one to send her to school and she was trained in business.She married at younger age and her husband's income is not ever enough to take care of the home. She runs a food stand business in Waterloo eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 5 years and sells peppers, ground nuts, onions, cooking oil and rice. Mariatu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more peppers, groundnuts, onions, cooking oil and rice for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and allow her to go to adult education school. In the future, she would like to become an international business woman. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, groundnuts, onions, cooking oil and rice for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old, married and has five children. She operates a cafe in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000. 

Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has applied for a loan of KES. 40,000 to buy additional stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, cereals and other foodstuffs, as well as items such as serving spoons, eating plates, tea cups and related items. In return she hopes to realize more sales which will translate into more income, improving the financial status and living standards of her family and enabling her to help pay school fees for her child. 

Beatrice intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, cereals and other foodstuffs,

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 45 years old and married to Naomi, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his business for about four years with an income of about 50,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

He is taking a fourth loan after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy car-wash equipment and expand the business. He hopes to be a leading car washer in the region and venture into a transport business.

loans.use: to buy car-wash equipment and expand the business.

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en: Salifu is single but has 1 child. He has received basic education to senior high school. Salifu is a petty trader in Hohoe market who deals in the sales of toothpaste and toothbrushes, which he has done for the past 7 years now since he completed school and couldn’t continue due to financial constraints. Salifu is responsible for the general upkeep of himself and his younger siblings. Salifu will use the loan to purchase boxes of toothpaste, assorted toothbrushes, and deal in the sales of detergents for killing insects. With the new profits from his expanded business, Salifu plans to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of toothpaste, assorted toothbrushes, and deal in the sales of detergents for killing insects.

loans.name: Joseph K.

texts.en:
Joseph deals in the sales of wood in Akpafu, Hohoe. Joseph received education from basic level through high school to diploma level. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a petty trader. 

Joseph has been dealing in the sales of wood since 2009. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his home. His loan will be used to acquire a machine for harvesting trees with the payment for trees taken before cutting. 

He intends to save his new profits from his expanded business to enable him give better and quality education to his children.

loans.use: to acquire a machine for harvesting trees, with the payment for trees taken before cutting.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which is known for its high production of milk and maize. She has two children and has been doing this work for 20 years. Her primary income sources are selling milk, eggs, tea and crops from her own business. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "harvesting season." Her biggest challenge is "raising funds to do farming as a business.” She will use the loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy two dairy cows. Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “humble officers.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “that you finance farmers.” Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Mary replied "improved family lifestyle.”

loans.use: to buy two cows for her farm.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 45 year old hardworking gentleman. He is married to Paanoi and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last five years and earns a monthly income of 29,000 KES. Justus learned about KADET LTD from other farmers in his neighborhood who are registered members. 

He is servicing his first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD . He intends to use it to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, manure, and sprays. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single 28-year-old woman. She lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, an area with the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She has a 10-year-old child, who lives at home and is in school.

Her education ceased in 8th grade. To earn a living, she has been selling red oil in the local market. She explains that she started this business with money given to her by her friends and that she learned the trade from them.

She is now requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her future plans are to educate her child and to build a house.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional red oil.

loans.name: Gerelsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Gerelsuren, 27 years old, lives with her husband and seven-year-old child in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Since 2010, she has been working at the train station. Her husband has been working for National Emergency Agency of Mongolia for six consecutive years. Their son goes to secondary school. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Using her previous loan, she has purchased furniture and made her house a comfortable living place. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks, cements and metals. Using these materials, she wants to make an extension to her house and build a garage for her automobile. The house extension will stop the heat loss through the door and building a garage will protect their automobile from harsh winter storms. The automobile, which is frozen for long perciods during winter nights, tends to waste more fuel and release more carbon dioxide and chemicals harmful to clean air. So, making an extension and building a garage is essential for reducing fuel usage, emitting less smoke and then contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to extend her house and build a garage

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 60 years old, married and has six children. Though he is old in age, he is still strong in managing the farming business they have, which is the family's primary source of income. They plant and harvest rice to sell. He also pays laborers who help them in the rice field. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 because he has insufficient funds to sustain his crops. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides that will help nourish the crops. 

Oscar still hopes for a smooth flow of operation in the farming business and to keep improving his output for his family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Mendsaikhan, 36 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 
Mendsaikhan has been working as a security worker at a private business entity. His wife works as a cleaner at the same entity.  

Together with his brother, he built a two flat house on his plot of land. The house will be used for people who want and seek a lower rent home, and
a comfortable living place. He is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 MNT to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass, foams, cotton, and cellulose. Using those materials, he can fully insulate the rental house, and people renting this house will burn less coal, emit less smoke, and contribute to efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is very hardworking individual who is concerned about the well being of others.

loans.use: to buy insulation for a two flat house.

loans.name: Omara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omara del Socorro de 27 años de edad,  casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. en su ratos libre le gusta disfrutar tiempo de calidad con su familia, prepárales una comida típica como es indio viejo. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administraccion de Empresa.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos de piñatas y fiestas infantiles. Como piñatas, platos vasos, cubiertos descartables, candelas, papelillos, globos, termos con  pajillas, sillas platicas, mesas, ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el cual lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercado de la localidad.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artículos de fiestas infantiles. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Omara del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Omara del Socorro, 27, is married with one son. She is from Managua, which is located in the central part of the country. In her free time, she likes to enjoy quality time with her family, preparing a typical meal such as "indio viejo" (a corn-based stew). Unfortunately, she was not able to go to college, but she would have liked to study business administration.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to succeed, she has a business selling piñatas and children's party supplies such as plates, glasses, disposable silverware, candles, confetti, balloons, thermoses with straws, plastic chairs and tables. She dedicates about 10 hours per day to her business, which is located in a market in her town.

She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying children's party supplies, so that in the not-so-distant future she can obtain a better income. Omara del Socorro is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying children's party supplies.

loans.name: Elgelyn

texts.en: To make a living, Elgelyn has been operating a buy and sell business for more than a year. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy rice and dried fish to sell. She wants to increase her sales everyday in order to cover her four children's necessities. She is doing her best to send them all to school though she lives alone with them.

loans.use: to buy rice and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
This is Cresilda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy the materials needed in her business (she sells bedding and mattresses. She makes and manufactures the bedding and mattresses, with the help of her husband)  Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 11,000 PHP loan for her to buy  foam, cloth, plastic, rugby, and other materials needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams that they will have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for foam, cloth, plastic, rugby and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios me fortalece está conformado por 13 integrantes, 10 mujeres, tres hombres, padres y madres responsables de 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, lucha dadores en la vida.  Por trabajan día  a día para bríndales a sus hijos un futuro mejor,  y que no tengan que trabajar desde temprana edad, como les toco a ellos.

La coordinadora del banco comunal Dios me Fortalece es Amada Jessenia, gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como café en sobre, sampoo en sobre, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, jugos, leche, huevos, tomates. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios me Fortalece agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Dios me Fortalece communal bank is made up of 13 members; 10 ladies and three gentlemen, responsible mothers and fathers with 20 children.  They are originally from Sauce, a place located in the western part of the country.  They are known for being hardworking and responsible in their lives.  They work daily to provide a better future for their children so that they will not need to go to work at an early age as they did.

Amada Jessenia is the coordinator of the Dios me Fortalece communal bank.  Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and desire to get ahead, she has a convenience store located in her home.  A convenience store is a small store where she sells various products, such as coffee, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, salt, juices, milk, eggs, and tomatoes in small amounts.  The objective of the loan is to invest in and grow her business so she can have a better income.  The communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide for those people of scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, allowing them to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mrs Batbayar, 45 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Using her previous loan, she began renting a grocery stall at the trade center and her business is doing well. Her husband purchased a truck in 2010 and since then, has been rendering transportation service to the local people. Also, her husband raises livestock in the countryside during the summer time and she makes and sells dairy products at her grocery stall. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks, cements and gypsum. These materials will be used for interior repairs and for a house extension. Building a barn as an extension to her house will reduce heat loss through the door and the interior repair will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her family.

loans.use: to make a house extension and do interior repairs

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina, 46, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Raul, a vendor, and the mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rufina operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed from the local market to make her product, then she processes it, and repacks it and sells it per piece to individuals, general store owners, and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 gram plastic bottles. She also makes stuffed meat. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
